module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.ClassifierEvaluationMetrics

-- | Describes the result metrics for the test data associated with an
--   documentation classifier.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClassifierEvaluationMetrics</a> smart constructor.
data ClassifierEvaluationMetrics
ClassifierEvaluationMetrics' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> ClassifierEvaluationMetrics

-- | A measure of how accurate the classifier results are for the test
--   data. It is derived from the <tt>Precision</tt> and <tt>Recall</tt>
--   values. The <tt>F1Score</tt> is the harmonic average of the two
--   scores. The highest score is 1, and the worst score is 0.
[$sel:f1Score:ClassifierEvaluationMetrics'] :: ClassifierEvaluationMetrics -> Maybe Double

-- | A measure of how complete the classifier results are for the test
--   data. High recall means that the classifier returned most of the
--   relevant results. Specifically, this indicates how many of the correct
--   categories in the text that the model can predict. It is a percentage
--   of correct categories in the text that can found. Instead of averaging
--   the recall scores of all labels (as with Recall), micro Recall is
--   based on the overall score of all recall scores added together.
[$sel:microRecall:ClassifierEvaluationMetrics'] :: ClassifierEvaluationMetrics -> Maybe Double

-- | A measure of the usefulness of the recognizer results in the test
--   data. High precision means that the recognizer returned substantially
--   more relevant results than irrelevant ones. Unlike the Precision
--   metric which comes from averaging the precision of all available
--   labels, this is based on the overall score of all precision scores
--   added together.
[$sel:microPrecision:ClassifierEvaluationMetrics'] :: ClassifierEvaluationMetrics -> Maybe Double

-- | A measure of the usefulness of the classifier results in the test
--   data. High precision means that the classifier returned substantially
--   more relevant results than irrelevant ones.
[$sel:precision:ClassifierEvaluationMetrics'] :: ClassifierEvaluationMetrics -> Maybe Double

-- | The fraction of the labels that were correct recognized. It is
--   computed by dividing the number of labels in the test documents that
--   were correctly recognized by the total number of labels in the test
--   documents.
[$sel:accuracy:ClassifierEvaluationMetrics'] :: ClassifierEvaluationMetrics -> Maybe Double

-- | Indicates the fraction of labels that are incorrectly predicted. Also
--   seen as the fraction of wrong labels compared to the total number of
--   labels. Scores closer to zero are better.
[$sel:hammingLoss:ClassifierEvaluationMetrics'] :: ClassifierEvaluationMetrics -> Maybe Double

-- | A measure of how complete the classifier results are for the test
--   data. High recall means that the classifier returned most of the
--   relevant results.
[$sel:recall:ClassifierEvaluationMetrics'] :: ClassifierEvaluationMetrics -> Maybe Double

-- | A measure of how accurate the classifier results are for the test
--   data. It is a combination of the <tt>Micro Precision</tt> and
--   <tt>Micro Recall</tt> values. The <tt>Micro F1Score</tt> is the
--   harmonic mean of the two scores. The highest score is 1, and the worst
--   score is 0.
[$sel:microF1Score:ClassifierEvaluationMetrics'] :: ClassifierEvaluationMetrics -> Maybe Double

-- | The number of documents in the input data that were used to test the

--   up to 10,000 documents.

--   classifier. Typically this is 80 to 90 percent of the input documents.

module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig

-- | Provides output results configuration parameters for custom classifier
--   jobs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig
DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig

-- | ID for the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend
--   uses to encrypt the output results from an analysis job. The KmsKeyId
--   can be one of the following formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: <tt>"1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   <li>KMS Key Alias: <tt>"alias/ExampleAlias"</tt></li>
--   <li>ARN of a KMS Key Alias:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias"</tt></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:kmsKeyId:DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig'] :: DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | When you use the <tt>OutputDataConfig</tt> object while creating a
--   custom classifier, you specify the Amazon S3 location where you want
--   to write the confusion matrix. The URI must be in the same region as
--   the API endpoint that you are calling. The location is used as the
--   prefix for the actual location of this output file.
--   
--   When the custom classifier job is finished, the service creates the
--   output file in a directory specific to the job. The <tt>S3Uri</tt>
--   field contains the location of the output file, called
--   <tt>output.tar.gz</tt>. It is a compressed archive that contains the
--   confusion matrix.
[$sel:s3Uri:DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig'] :: DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierOutputDataConfig_kmsKeyId</a> - ID for the AWS
--   Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to
--   encrypt the output results from an analysis job. The KmsKeyId can be
--   one of the following formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: <tt>"1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   <li>KMS Key Alias: <tt>"alias/ExampleAlias"</tt></li>
--   <li>ARN of a KMS Key Alias:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias"</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Uri:DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierOutputDataConfig_s3Uri</a> - When you use the
--   <tt>OutputDataConfig</tt> object while creating a custom classifier,
--   you specify the Amazon S3 location where you want to write the
--   confusion matrix. The URI must be in the same region as the API
--   endpoint that you are calling. The location is used as the prefix for
--   the actual location of this output file.
--   
--   When the custom classifier job is finished, the service creates the
--   output file in a directory specific to the job. The <tt>S3Uri</tt>
--   field contains the location of the output file, called
--   <tt>output.tar.gz</tt>. It is a compressed archive that contains the
--   confusion matrix.
newDocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig :: DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig

-- | ID for the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend
--   uses to encrypt the output results from an analysis job. The KmsKeyId
--   can be one of the following formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: <tt>"1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   <li>KMS Key Alias: <tt>"alias/ExampleAlias"</tt></li>
--   <li>ARN of a KMS Key Alias:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias"</tt></li>
--   </ul>
documentClassifierOutputDataConfig_kmsKeyId :: Lens' DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | When you use the <tt>OutputDataConfig</tt> object while creating a
--   custom classifier, you specify the Amazon S3 location where you want
--   to write the confusion matrix. The URI must be in the same region as
--   the API endpoint that you are calling. The location is used as the
--   prefix for the actual location of this output file.
--   
--   When the custom classifier job is finished, the service creates the
--   output file in a directory specific to the job. The <tt>S3Uri</tt>
--   field contains the location of the output file, called
--   <tt>output.tar.gz</tt>. It is a compressed archive that contains the
--   confusion matrix.
documentClassifierOutputDataConfig_s3Uri :: Lens' DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig.DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig.DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig.DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig.DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig.DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig.DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig.DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig.DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig


module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DocumentLabel

-- | Specifies one of the label or labels that categorize the document
--   being analyzed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDocumentLabel</a> smart constructor.
data DocumentLabel
DocumentLabel' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> DocumentLabel

-- | The name of the label.
[$sel:name:DocumentLabel'] :: DocumentLabel -> Maybe Text

-- | The confidence score that Amazon Comprehend has this label correctly
--   attributed.
[$sel:score:DocumentLabel'] :: DocumentLabel -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>DocumentLabel</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   of the label.
--   
--   <a>$sel:score:DocumentLabel'</a>, <a>documentLabel_score</a> - The
--   confidence score that Amazon Comprehend has this label correctly
--   attributed.
newDocumentLabel :: DocumentLabel

-- | The name of the label.
documentLabel_name :: Lens' DocumentLabel (Maybe Text)

-- | The confidence score that Amazon Comprehend has this label correctly
--   attributed.
documentLabel_score :: Lens' DocumentLabel (Maybe Double)

module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DocumentReadFeatureTypes

-- | A list of the types of analyses to perform. This field specifies what
--   feature types need to be extracted from the document where entity
--   recognition is expected.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TABLES</tt> - Add TABLES to the list to return information
--   about the tables that are detected in the input document.</li>
--   <li><tt>FORMS</tt> - Add FORMS to return detected form data.</li>
--   </ul>
newtype DocumentReadFeatureTypes

module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DocumentReaderConfig

-- | The input properties for a topic detection job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDocumentReaderConfig</a> smart constructor.
data DocumentReaderConfig
DocumentReaderConfig' :: Maybe (NonEmpty DocumentReadFeatureTypes) -> Maybe DocumentReadMode -> DocumentReadAction -> DocumentReaderConfig

-- | Specifies how the text in an input file should be processed:
[$sel:featureTypes:DocumentReaderConfig'] :: DocumentReaderConfig -> Maybe (NonEmpty DocumentReadFeatureTypes)

-- | This enum field provides two values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>SERVICE_DEFAULT</tt> - use service defaults for Document
--   reading. For Digital PDF it would mean using an internal parser
--   instead of Textract APIs</li>
--   <li><tt>FORCE_DOCUMENT_READ_ACTION</tt> - Always use specified action
--   for DocumentReadAction, including Digital PDF.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:documentReadMode:DocumentReaderConfig'] :: DocumentReaderConfig -> Maybe DocumentReadMode

-- | This enum field will start with two values which will apply to PDFs:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TEXTRACT_DETECT_DOCUMENT_TEXT</tt> - The service calls
--   DetectDocumentText for PDF documents per page.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEXTRACT_ANALYZE_DOCUMENT</tt> - The service calls
--   AnalyzeDocument for PDF documents per page.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:documentReadAction:DocumentReaderConfig'] :: DocumentReaderConfig -> DocumentReadAction

-- | Create a value of <a>DocumentReaderConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:featureTypes:DocumentReaderConfig'</a>,
--   <a>documentReaderConfig_featureTypes</a> - Specifies how the text in
--   an input file should be processed:
--   
--   <a>$sel:documentReadMode:DocumentReaderConfig'</a>,
--   <a>documentReaderConfig_documentReadMode</a> - This enum field
--   provides two values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>SERVICE_DEFAULT</tt> - use service defaults for Document
--   reading. For Digital PDF it would mean using an internal parser
--   instead of Textract APIs</li>
--   <li><tt>FORCE_DOCUMENT_READ_ACTION</tt> - Always use specified action
--   for DocumentReadAction, including Digital PDF.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:documentReadAction:DocumentReaderConfig'</a>,
--   <a>documentReaderConfig_documentReadAction</a> - This enum field will
--   start with two values which will apply to PDFs:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TEXTRACT_DETECT_DOCUMENT_TEXT</tt> - The service calls
--   DetectDocumentText for PDF documents per page.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEXTRACT_ANALYZE_DOCUMENT</tt> - The service calls
--   AnalyzeDocument for PDF documents per page.</li>
--   </ul>
newDocumentReaderConfig :: DocumentReadAction -> DocumentReaderConfig

-- | Specifies how the text in an input file should be processed:
documentReaderConfig_featureTypes :: Lens' DocumentReaderConfig (Maybe (NonEmpty DocumentReadFeatureTypes))

-- | This enum field provides two values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>SERVICE_DEFAULT</tt> - use service defaults for Document
--   reading. For Digital PDF it would mean using an internal parser
--   instead of Textract APIs</li>
--   <li><tt>FORCE_DOCUMENT_READ_ACTION</tt> - Always use specified action
--   for DocumentReadAction, including Digital PDF.</li>
--   </ul>
documentReaderConfig_documentReadMode :: Lens' DocumentReaderConfig (Maybe DocumentReadMode)

-- | This enum field will start with two values which will apply to PDFs:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TEXTRACT_DETECT_DOCUMENT_TEXT</tt> - The service calls
--   DetectDocumentText for PDF documents per page.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEXTRACT_ANALYZE_DOCUMENT</tt> - The service calls
--   AnalyzeDocument for PDF documents per page.</li>
--   </ul>
documentReaderConfig_documentReadAction :: Lens' DocumentReaderConfig DocumentReadAction
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DocumentReaderConfig.DocumentReaderConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DocumentReaderConfig.DocumentReaderConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DocumentReaderConfig.DocumentReaderConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DocumentReaderConfig.DocumentReaderConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DocumentReaderConfig.DocumentReaderConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DocumentReaderConfig.DocumentReaderConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DocumentReaderConfig.DocumentReaderConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DocumentReaderConfig.DocumentReaderConfig


module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DominantLanguage

-- | Returns the code for the dominant language in the input text and the
--   level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of the
--   detection.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDominantLanguage</a> smart constructor.
data DominantLanguage
DominantLanguage' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> DominantLanguage

-- | The RFC 5646 language code for the dominant language. For more
--   information about RFC 5646, see <a>Tags for Identifying Languages</a>
--   on the <i>IETF Tools</i> web site.
[$sel:languageCode:DominantLanguage'] :: DominantLanguage -> Maybe Text

-- | The level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of
--   the detection.
[$sel:score:DominantLanguage'] :: DominantLanguage -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>DominantLanguage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:DominantLanguage'</a>,
--   <a>dominantLanguage_languageCode</a> - The RFC 5646 language code for
--   the dominant language. For more information about RFC 5646, see
--   <a>Tags for Identifying Languages</a> on the <i>IETF Tools</i> web
--   site.
--   
--   <a>$sel:score:DominantLanguage'</a>, <a>dominantLanguage_score</a> -
--   The level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of
--   the detection.
newDominantLanguage :: DominantLanguage

-- | The RFC 5646 language code for the dominant language. For more
--   information about RFC 5646, see <a>Tags for Identifying Languages</a>
--   on the <i>IETF Tools</i> web site.
dominantLanguage_languageCode :: Lens' DominantLanguage (Maybe Text)

-- | The level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of
--   the detection.
dominantLanguage_score :: Lens' DominantLanguage (Maybe Double)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DominantLanguage.DominantLanguage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DominantLanguage.DominantLanguage
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DominantLanguage.DominantLanguage
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DominantLanguage.DominantLanguage
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DominantLanguage.DominantLanguage
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DominantLanguage.DominantLanguage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.DominantLanguage.DominantLanguage


module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult

-- | The result of calling the operation. The operation returns one object
--   for each document that is successfully processed by the operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult</a> smart
--   constructor.
data BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult
BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult' :: Maybe [DominantLanguage] -> Maybe Int -> BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult

-- | One or more DominantLanguage objects describing the dominant languages
--   in the document.
[$sel:languages:BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult'] :: BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult -> Maybe [DominantLanguage]

-- | The zero-based index of the document in the input list.
[$sel:index:BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult'] :: BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languages:BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult'</a>,
--   <a>batchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult_languages</a> - One or more
--   DominantLanguage objects describing the dominant languages in the
--   document.
--   
--   <a>$sel:index:BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult'</a>,
--   <a>batchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult_index</a> - The zero-based
--   index of the document in the input list.
newBatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult :: BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult

-- | One or more DominantLanguage objects describing the dominant languages
--   in the document.
batchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult_languages :: Lens' BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult (Maybe [DominantLanguage])

-- | The zero-based index of the document in the input list.
batchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult_index :: Lens' BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult.BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult.BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult.BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult.BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult

module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EndpointProperties

-- | Specifies information about the specified endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointProperties</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointProperties
EndpointProperties' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe EndpointStatus -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EndpointProperties

-- | The number of inference units currently used by the model using this
--   endpoint.
[$sel:currentInferenceUnits:EndpointProperties'] :: EndpointProperties -> Maybe Natural

-- | The creation date and time of the endpoint.
[$sel:creationTime:EndpointProperties'] :: EndpointProperties -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Specifies the status of the endpoint. Because the endpoint updates and
--   creation are asynchronous, so customers will need to wait for the
--   endpoint to be <tt>Ready</tt> status before making inference requests.
[$sel:status:EndpointProperties'] :: EndpointProperties -> Maybe EndpointStatus

-- | The desired number of inference units to be used by the model using
--   this endpoint. Each inference unit represents of a throughput of 100
--   characters per second.
[$sel:desiredInferenceUnits:EndpointProperties'] :: EndpointProperties -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies a reason for failure in cases of <tt>Failed</tt> status.
[$sel:message:EndpointProperties'] :: EndpointProperties -> Maybe Text

-- | Data access role ARN to use in case the new model is encrypted with a
--   customer KMS key.
[$sel:desiredDataAccessRoleArn:EndpointProperties'] :: EndpointProperties -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the model to which the endpoint is
--   attached.
[$sel:modelArn:EndpointProperties'] :: EndpointProperties -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time that the endpoint was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedTime:EndpointProperties'] :: EndpointProperties -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the endpoint.
[$sel:endpointArn:EndpointProperties'] :: EndpointProperties -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that grants Amazon Comprehend read access to
--   trained custom models encrypted with a customer managed key
--   (ModelKmsKeyId).
[$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:EndpointProperties'] :: EndpointProperties -> Maybe Text

-- | ARN of the new model to use for updating an existing endpoint. This
--   ARN is going to be different from the model ARN when the update is in
--   progress
[$sel:desiredModelArn:EndpointProperties'] :: EndpointProperties -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointProperties</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentInferenceUnits:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_currentInferenceUnits</a> - The number of
--   inference units currently used by the model using this endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_creationTime</a> - The creation date and time of
--   the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_status</a> - Specifies the status of the
--   endpoint. Because the endpoint updates and creation are asynchronous,
--   so customers will need to wait for the endpoint to be <tt>Ready</tt>
--   status before making inference requests.
--   
--   <a>$sel:desiredInferenceUnits:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_desiredInferenceUnits</a> - The desired number
--   of inference units to be used by the model using this endpoint. Each
--   inference unit represents of a throughput of 100 characters per
--   second.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_message</a> - Specifies a reason for failure in
--   cases of <tt>Failed</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:desiredDataAccessRoleArn:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_desiredDataAccessRoleArn</a> - Data access role
--   ARN to use in case the new model is encrypted with a customer KMS key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelArn:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_modelArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Number (ARN)
--   of the model to which the endpoint is attached.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedTime:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_lastModifiedTime</a> - The date and time that
--   the endpoint was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointArn:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_endpointArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Number
--   (ARN) of the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_dataAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the AWS identity and Access Management (IAM) role that grants
--   Amazon Comprehend read access to trained custom models encrypted with
--   a customer managed key (ModelKmsKeyId).
--   
--   <a>$sel:desiredModelArn:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_desiredModelArn</a> - ARN of the new model to
--   use for updating an existing endpoint. This ARN is going to be
--   different from the model ARN when the update is in progress
newEndpointProperties :: EndpointProperties

-- | The number of inference units currently used by the model using this
--   endpoint.
endpointProperties_currentInferenceUnits :: Lens' EndpointProperties (Maybe Natural)

-- | The creation date and time of the endpoint.
endpointProperties_creationTime :: Lens' EndpointProperties (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies the status of the endpoint. Because the endpoint updates and
--   creation are asynchronous, so customers will need to wait for the
--   endpoint to be <tt>Ready</tt> status before making inference requests.
endpointProperties_status :: Lens' EndpointProperties (Maybe EndpointStatus)

-- | The desired number of inference units to be used by the model using
--   this endpoint. Each inference unit represents of a throughput of 100
--   characters per second.
endpointProperties_desiredInferenceUnits :: Lens' EndpointProperties (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies a reason for failure in cases of <tt>Failed</tt> status.
endpointProperties_message :: Lens' EndpointProperties (Maybe Text)

-- | Data access role ARN to use in case the new model is encrypted with a
--   customer KMS key.
endpointProperties_desiredDataAccessRoleArn :: Lens' EndpointProperties (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the model to which the endpoint is
--   attached.
endpointProperties_modelArn :: Lens' EndpointProperties (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that the endpoint was last modified.
endpointProperties_lastModifiedTime :: Lens' EndpointProperties (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the endpoint.
endpointProperties_endpointArn :: Lens' EndpointProperties (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that grants Amazon Comprehend read access to
--   trained custom models encrypted with a customer managed key
--   (ModelKmsKeyId).
endpointProperties_dataAccessRoleArn :: Lens' EndpointProperties (Maybe Text)

-- | ARN of the new model to use for updating an existing endpoint. This
--   ARN is going to be different from the model ARN when the update is in
--   progress
endpointProperties_desiredModelArn :: Lens' EndpointProperties (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EndpointProperties.EndpointProperties
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EndpointProperties.EndpointProperties
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EndpointProperties.EndpointProperties
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EndpointProperties.EndpointProperties
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EndpointProperties.EndpointProperties
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EndpointProperties.EndpointProperties
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EndpointProperties.EndpointProperties


module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EndpointFilter

-- | The filter used to determine which endpoints are returned. You can
--   filter jobs on their name, model, status, or the date and time that
--   they were created. You can only set one filter at a time.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointFilter</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointFilter
EndpointFilter' :: Maybe EndpointStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> EndpointFilter

-- | Specifies the status of the endpoint being returned. Possible values
--   are: Creating, Ready, Updating, Deleting, Failed.
[$sel:status:EndpointFilter'] :: EndpointFilter -> Maybe EndpointStatus

-- | Specifies a date before which the returned endpoint or endpoints were
--   created.
[$sel:creationTimeBefore:EndpointFilter'] :: EndpointFilter -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the model to which the endpoint is
--   attached.
[$sel:modelArn:EndpointFilter'] :: EndpointFilter -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies a date after which the returned endpoint or endpoints were
--   created.
[$sel:creationTimeAfter:EndpointFilter'] :: EndpointFilter -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:EndpointFilter'</a>, <a>endpointFilter_status</a> -
--   Specifies the status of the endpoint being returned. Possible values
--   are: Creating, Ready, Updating, Deleting, Failed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTimeBefore:EndpointFilter'</a>,
--   <a>endpointFilter_creationTimeBefore</a> - Specifies a date before
--   which the returned endpoint or endpoints were created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelArn:EndpointFilter'</a>, <a>endpointFilter_modelArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the model to which the endpoint is
--   attached.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTimeAfter:EndpointFilter'</a>,
--   <a>endpointFilter_creationTimeAfter</a> - Specifies a date after which
--   the returned endpoint or endpoints were created.
newEndpointFilter :: EndpointFilter

-- | Specifies the status of the endpoint being returned. Possible values
--   are: Creating, Ready, Updating, Deleting, Failed.
endpointFilter_status :: Lens' EndpointFilter (Maybe EndpointStatus)

-- | Specifies a date before which the returned endpoint or endpoints were
--   created.
endpointFilter_creationTimeBefore :: Lens' EndpointFilter (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the model to which the endpoint is
--   attached.
endpointFilter_modelArn :: Lens' EndpointFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies a date after which the returned endpoint or endpoints were
--   created.
endpointFilter_creationTimeAfter :: Lens' EndpointFilter (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EndpointFilter.EndpointFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EndpointFilter.EndpointFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EndpointFilter.EndpointFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EndpointFilter.EndpointFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EndpointFilter.EndpointFilter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EndpointFilter.EndpointFilter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EndpointFilter.EndpointFilter


module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityRecognizerAnnotations

-- | Describes the annotations associated with a entity recognizer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEntityRecognizerAnnotations</a> smart constructor.
data EntityRecognizerAnnotations
EntityRecognizerAnnotations' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> EntityRecognizerAnnotations

-- | This specifies the Amazon S3 location where the test annotations for
--   an entity recognizer are located. The URI must be in the same AWS
--   Region as the API endpoint that you are calling.
[$sel:testS3Uri:EntityRecognizerAnnotations'] :: EntityRecognizerAnnotations -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the Amazon S3 location where the annotations for an entity
--   recognizer are located. The URI must be in the same region as the API
--   endpoint that you are calling.
[$sel:s3Uri:EntityRecognizerAnnotations'] :: EntityRecognizerAnnotations -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EntityRecognizerAnnotations</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:testS3Uri:EntityRecognizerAnnotations'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerAnnotations_testS3Uri</a> - This specifies the
--   Amazon S3 location where the test annotations for an entity recognizer
--   are located. The URI must be in the same AWS Region as the API
--   endpoint that you are calling.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Uri:EntityRecognizerAnnotations'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerAnnotations_s3Uri</a> - Specifies the Amazon S3
--   location where the annotations for an entity recognizer are located.
--   The URI must be in the same region as the API endpoint that you are
--   calling.
newEntityRecognizerAnnotations :: Text -> EntityRecognizerAnnotations

-- | This specifies the Amazon S3 location where the test annotations for
--   an entity recognizer are located. The URI must be in the same AWS
--   Region as the API endpoint that you are calling.
entityRecognizerAnnotations_testS3Uri :: Lens' EntityRecognizerAnnotations (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the Amazon S3 location where the annotations for an entity
--   recognizer are located. The URI must be in the same region as the API
--   endpoint that you are calling.
entityRecognizerAnnotations_s3Uri :: Lens' EntityRecognizerAnnotations Text

module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics

-- | Detailed information about the accuracy of an entity recognizer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics</a> smart
--   constructor.
data EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics
EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics

-- | A measure of how accurate the recognizer results are for the test
--   data. It is derived from the <tt>Precision</tt> and <tt>Recall</tt>
--   values. The <tt>F1Score</tt> is the harmonic average of the two
--   scores. The highest score is 1, and the worst score is 0.
[$sel:f1Score:EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics'] :: EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics -> Maybe Double

-- | A measure of the usefulness of the recognizer results in the test
--   data. High precision means that the recognizer returned substantially
--   more relevant results than irrelevant ones.
[$sel:precision:EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics'] :: EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics -> Maybe Double

-- | A measure of how complete the recognizer results are for the test
--   data. High recall means that the recognizer returned most of the
--   relevant results.
[$sel:recall:EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics'] :: EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:f1Score:EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics_f1Score</a> - A measure of how
--   accurate the recognizer results are for the test data. It is derived
--   from the <tt>Precision</tt> and <tt>Recall</tt> values. The
--   <tt>F1Score</tt> is the harmonic average of the two scores. The
--   highest score is 1, and the worst score is 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:precision:EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics_precision</a> - A measure of the
--   usefulness of the recognizer results in the test data. High precision
--   means that the recognizer returned substantially more relevant results
--   than irrelevant ones.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recall:EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics_recall</a> - A measure of how
--   complete the recognizer results are for the test data. High recall
--   means that the recognizer returned most of the relevant results.
newEntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics :: EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics

-- | A measure of how accurate the recognizer results are for the test
--   data. It is derived from the <tt>Precision</tt> and <tt>Recall</tt>
--   values. The <tt>F1Score</tt> is the harmonic average of the two
--   scores. The highest score is 1, and the worst score is 0.
entityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics_f1Score :: Lens' EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics (Maybe Double)

-- | A measure of the usefulness of the recognizer results in the test
--   data. High precision means that the recognizer returned substantially
--   more relevant results than irrelevant ones.
entityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics_precision :: Lens' EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics (Maybe Double)

-- | A measure of how complete the recognizer results are for the test
--   data. High recall means that the recognizer returned most of the
--   relevant results.
entityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics_recall :: Lens' EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics (Maybe Double)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics.EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics.EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics.EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics.EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics.EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics.EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics.EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics

module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.Entity

-- | Provides information about an entity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEntity</a> smart constructor.
data Entity
Entity' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe EntityType -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Entity

-- | A character offset in the input text that shows where the entity ends.
--   The offset returns the position of each UTF-8 code point in the
--   string. A <i>code point</i> is the abstract character from a
--   particular graphical representation. For example, a multi-byte UTF-8
--   character maps to a single code point.
[$sel:endOffset:Entity'] :: Entity -> Maybe Int

-- | The entity's type.
[$sel:type':Entity'] :: Entity -> Maybe EntityType

-- | The level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of
--   the detection.
[$sel:score:Entity'] :: Entity -> Maybe Double

-- | The text of the entity.
[$sel:text:Entity'] :: Entity -> Maybe Text

-- | A character offset in the input text that shows where the entity
--   begins (the first character is at position 0). The offset returns the
--   position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A <i>code point</i>
--   is the abstract character from a particular graphical representation.
--   For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character maps to a single code point.
[$sel:beginOffset:Entity'] :: Entity -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>Entity</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endOffset:Entity'</a>, <a>entity_endOffset</a> - A character
--   offset in the input text that shows where the entity ends. The offset
--   returns the position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A <i>code
--   point</i> is the abstract character from a particular graphical
--   representation. For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character maps to a
--   single code point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Entity'</a>, <a>entity_type</a> - The entity's type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:score:Entity'</a>, <a>entity_score</a> - The level of
--   confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of the
--   detection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:text:Entity'</a>, <a>entity_text</a> - The text of the entity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:beginOffset:Entity'</a>, <a>entity_beginOffset</a> - A
--   character offset in the input text that shows where the entity begins
--   (the first character is at position 0). The offset returns the
--   position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A <i>code point</i>
--   is the abstract character from a particular graphical representation.
--   For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character maps to a single code point.
newEntity :: Entity

-- | A character offset in the input text that shows where the entity ends.
--   The offset returns the position of each UTF-8 code point in the
--   string. A <i>code point</i> is the abstract character from a
--   particular graphical representation. For example, a multi-byte UTF-8
--   character maps to a single code point.
entity_endOffset :: Lens' Entity (Maybe Int)

-- | The entity's type.
entity_type :: Lens' Entity (Maybe EntityType)

-- | The level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of
--   the detection.
entity_score :: Lens' Entity (Maybe Double)

-- | The text of the entity.
entity_text :: Lens' Entity (Maybe Text)

-- | A character offset in the input text that shows where the entity
--   begins (the first character is at position 0). The offset returns the
--   position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A <i>code point</i>
--   is the abstract character from a particular graphical representation.
--   For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character maps to a single code point.
entity_beginOffset :: Lens' Entity (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.Entity.Entity
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.Entity.Entity
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.Entity.Entity
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.Entity.Entity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.Entity.Entity
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.Entity.Entity
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.Entity.Entity


module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.BatchDetectEntitiesItemResult

-- | The result of calling the operation. The operation returns one object
--   for each document that is successfully processed by the operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBatchDetectEntitiesItemResult</a> smart constructor.
data BatchDetectEntitiesItemResult
BatchDetectEntitiesItemResult' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe [Entity] -> BatchDetectEntitiesItemResult

-- | The zero-based index of the document in the input list.
[$sel:index:BatchDetectEntitiesItemResult'] :: BatchDetectEntitiesItemResult -> Maybe Int

-- | One or more Entity objects, one for each entity detected in the
--   document.
[$sel:entities:BatchDetectEntitiesItemResult'] :: BatchDetectEntitiesItemResult -> Maybe [Entity]

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>batchDetectEntitiesItemResult_index</a> - The zero-based index of
--   the document in the input list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entities:BatchDetectEntitiesItemResult'</a>,
--   <a>batchDetectEntitiesItemResult_entities</a> - One or more Entity
--   objects, one for each entity detected in the document.
newBatchDetectEntitiesItemResult :: BatchDetectEntitiesItemResult

-- | The zero-based index of the document in the input list.
batchDetectEntitiesItemResult_index :: Lens' BatchDetectEntitiesItemResult (Maybe Int)

-- | One or more Entity objects, one for each entity detected in the
--   document.
batchDetectEntitiesItemResult_entities :: Lens' BatchDetectEntitiesItemResult (Maybe [Entity])

module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics

-- | Detailed information about the accuracy of an entity recognizer for a
--   specific entity type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEntityTypesEvaluationMetrics</a> smart constructor.
data EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics
EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics

-- | A measure of how accurate the recognizer results are for a specific
--   entity type in the test data. It is derived from the
--   <tt>Precision</tt> and <tt>Recall</tt> values. The <tt>F1Score</tt> is
--   the harmonic average of the two scores. The highest score is 1, and
--   the worst score is 0.
[$sel:f1Score:EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics'] :: EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics -> Maybe Double

-- | A measure of the usefulness of the recognizer results for a specific
--   entity type in the test data. High precision means that the recognizer
--   returned substantially more relevant results than irrelevant ones.
[$sel:precision:EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics'] :: EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics -> Maybe Double

-- | A measure of how complete the recognizer results are for a specific
--   entity type in the test data. High recall means that the recognizer
--   returned most of the relevant results.
[$sel:recall:EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics'] :: EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:f1Score:EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>entityTypesEvaluationMetrics_f1Score</a> - A measure of how
--   accurate the recognizer results are for a specific entity type in the
--   test data. It is derived from the <tt>Precision</tt> and
--   <tt>Recall</tt> values. The <tt>F1Score</tt> is the harmonic average
--   of the two scores. The highest score is 1, and the worst score is 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:precision:EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>entityTypesEvaluationMetrics_precision</a> - A measure of the
--   usefulness of the recognizer results for a specific entity type in the
--   test data. High precision means that the recognizer returned
--   substantially more relevant results than irrelevant ones.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recall:EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>entityTypesEvaluationMetrics_recall</a> - A measure of how complete
--   the recognizer results are for a specific entity type in the test
--   data. High recall means that the recognizer returned most of the
--   relevant results.
newEntityTypesEvaluationMetrics :: EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics

-- | A measure of how accurate the recognizer results are for a specific
--   entity type in the test data. It is derived from the
--   <tt>Precision</tt> and <tt>Recall</tt> values. The <tt>F1Score</tt> is
--   the harmonic average of the two scores. The highest score is 1, and
--   the worst score is 0.
entityTypesEvaluationMetrics_f1Score :: Lens' EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics (Maybe Double)

-- | A measure of the usefulness of the recognizer results for a specific
--   entity type in the test data. High precision means that the recognizer
--   returned substantially more relevant results than irrelevant ones.
entityTypesEvaluationMetrics_precision :: Lens' EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics (Maybe Double)

-- | A measure of how complete the recognizer results are for a specific
--   entity type in the test data. High recall means that the recognizer
--   returned most of the relevant results.
entityTypesEvaluationMetrics_recall :: Lens' EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics (Maybe Double)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics.EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics.EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics.EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics.EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics.EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics.EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics.EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics

module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityRecognizerMetadata

-- | Detailed information about an entity recognizer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEntityRecognizerMetadata</a> smart constructor.
data EntityRecognizerMetadata
EntityRecognizerMetadata' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics -> Maybe [EntityRecognizerMetadataEntityTypesListItem] -> EntityRecognizerMetadata

-- | The number of documents in the input data that were used to test the
--   entity recognizer. Typically this is 10 to 20 percent of the input
--   documents.
[$sel:numberOfTestDocuments:EntityRecognizerMetadata'] :: EntityRecognizerMetadata -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of documents in the input data that were used to train the
--   entity recognizer. Typically this is 80 to 90 percent of the input
--   documents.
[$sel:numberOfTrainedDocuments:EntityRecognizerMetadata'] :: EntityRecognizerMetadata -> Maybe Int

-- | Detailed information about the accuracy of an entity recognizer.
[$sel:evaluationMetrics:EntityRecognizerMetadata'] :: EntityRecognizerMetadata -> Maybe EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics

-- | Entity types from the metadata of an entity recognizer.
[$sel:entityTypes:EntityRecognizerMetadata'] :: EntityRecognizerMetadata -> Maybe [EntityRecognizerMetadataEntityTypesListItem]

-- | Create a value of <a>EntityRecognizerMetadata</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfTestDocuments:EntityRecognizerMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerMetadata_numberOfTestDocuments</a> - The number of
--   documents in the input data that were used to test the entity
--   recognizer. Typically this is 10 to 20 percent of the input documents.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfTrainedDocuments:EntityRecognizerMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerMetadata_numberOfTrainedDocuments</a> - The number
--   of documents in the input data that were used to train the entity
--   recognizer. Typically this is 80 to 90 percent of the input documents.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluationMetrics:EntityRecognizerMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerMetadata_evaluationMetrics</a> - Detailed
--   information about the accuracy of an entity recognizer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityTypes:EntityRecognizerMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerMetadata_entityTypes</a> - Entity types from the
--   metadata of an entity recognizer.
newEntityRecognizerMetadata :: EntityRecognizerMetadata

-- | The number of documents in the input data that were used to test the
--   entity recognizer. Typically this is 10 to 20 percent of the input
--   documents.
entityRecognizerMetadata_numberOfTestDocuments :: Lens' EntityRecognizerMetadata (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of documents in the input data that were used to train the
--   entity recognizer. Typically this is 80 to 90 percent of the input
--   documents.
entityRecognizerMetadata_numberOfTrainedDocuments :: Lens' EntityRecognizerMetadata (Maybe Int)

-- | Detailed information about the accuracy of an entity recognizer.
entityRecognizerMetadata_evaluationMetrics :: Lens' EntityRecognizerMetadata (Maybe EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics)

module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityTypesListItem

-- | An entity type within a labeled training dataset that Amazon
--   Comprehend uses to train a custom entity recognizer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEntityTypesListItem</a> smart constructor.
data EntityTypesListItem
EntityTypesListItem' :: Text -> EntityTypesListItem

-- | An entity type within a labeled training dataset that Amazon
--   Comprehend uses to train a custom entity recognizer.
--   
--   Entity types must not contain the following invalid characters: \n
--   (line break), \\n (escaped line break, \r (carriage return), \\r
--   (escaped carriage return), \t (tab), \\t (escaped tab), space, and ,
--   (comma).
[$sel:type':EntityTypesListItem'] :: EntityTypesListItem -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EntityTypesListItem</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':EntityTypesListItem'</a>,
--   <a>entityTypesListItem_type</a> - An entity type within a labeled
--   training dataset that Amazon Comprehend uses to train a custom entity
--   recognizer.
--   
--   Entity types must not contain the following invalid characters: \n
--   (line break), \\n (escaped line break, \r (carriage return), \\r
--   (escaped carriage return), \t (tab), \\t (escaped tab), space, and ,
--   (comma).
newEntityTypesListItem :: Text -> EntityTypesListItem

-- | An entity type within a labeled training dataset that Amazon
--   Comprehend uses to train a custom entity recognizer.
--   
--   Entity types must not contain the following invalid characters: \n
--   (line break), \\n (escaped line break, \r (carriage return), \\r
--   (escaped carriage return), \t (tab), \\t (escaped tab), space, and ,
--   (comma).
entityTypesListItem_type :: Lens' EntityTypesListItem Text

module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.InputDataConfig

-- | The input properties for an inference job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputDataConfig</a> smart constructor.
data InputDataConfig
InputDataConfig' :: Maybe DocumentReaderConfig -> Maybe InputFormat -> Text -> InputDataConfig

-- | The document reader config field applies only for InputDataConfig of
--   StartEntitiesDetectionJob.
--   
--   Use DocumentReaderConfig to provide specifications about how you want
--   your inference documents read. Currently it applies for PDF documents
--   in StartEntitiesDetectionJob custom inference.
[$sel:documentReaderConfig:InputDataConfig'] :: InputDataConfig -> Maybe DocumentReaderConfig

-- | Specifies how the text in an input file should be processed:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ONE_DOC_PER_FILE</tt> - Each file is considered a separate
--   document. Use this option when you are processing large documents,
--   such as newspaper articles or scientific papers.</li>
--   <li><tt>ONE_DOC_PER_LINE</tt> - Each line in a file is considered a
--   separate document. Use this option when you are processing many short
--   documents, such as text messages.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:inputFormat:InputDataConfig'] :: InputDataConfig -> Maybe InputFormat

-- | The Amazon S3 URI for the input data. The URI must be in same region
--   as the API endpoint that you are calling. The URI can point to a
--   single input file or it can provide the prefix for a collection of
--   data files.
--   
--   For example, if you use the URI <tt>S3://bucketName/prefix</tt>, if
--   the prefix is a single file, Amazon Comprehend uses that file as
--   input. If more than one file begins with the prefix, Amazon Comprehend
--   uses all of them as input.
[$sel:s3Uri:InputDataConfig'] :: InputDataConfig -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InputDataConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:documentReaderConfig:InputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>inputDataConfig_documentReaderConfig</a> - The document reader
--   config field applies only for InputDataConfig of
--   StartEntitiesDetectionJob.
--   
--   Use DocumentReaderConfig to provide specifications about how you want
--   your inference documents read. Currently it applies for PDF documents
--   in StartEntitiesDetectionJob custom inference.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputFormat:InputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>inputDataConfig_inputFormat</a> - Specifies how the text in an
--   input file should be processed:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ONE_DOC_PER_FILE</tt> - Each file is considered a separate
--   document. Use this option when you are processing large documents,
--   such as newspaper articles or scientific papers.</li>
--   <li><tt>ONE_DOC_PER_LINE</tt> - Each line in a file is considered a
--   separate document. Use this option when you are processing many short
--   documents, such as text messages.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Uri:InputDataConfig'</a>, <a>inputDataConfig_s3Uri</a> - The
--   Amazon S3 URI for the input data. The URI must be in same region as
--   the API endpoint that you are calling. The URI can point to a single
--   input file or it can provide the prefix for a collection of data
--   files.
--   
--   For example, if you use the URI <tt>S3://bucketName/prefix</tt>, if
--   the prefix is a single file, Amazon Comprehend uses that file as
--   input. If more than one file begins with the prefix, Amazon Comprehend
--   uses all of them as input.
newInputDataConfig :: Text -> InputDataConfig

-- | The document reader config field applies only for InputDataConfig of
--   StartEntitiesDetectionJob.
--   
--   Use DocumentReaderConfig to provide specifications about how you want
--   your inference documents read. Currently it applies for PDF documents
--   in StartEntitiesDetectionJob custom inference.
inputDataConfig_documentReaderConfig :: Lens' InputDataConfig (Maybe DocumentReaderConfig)

-- | Specifies how the text in an input file should be processed:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ONE_DOC_PER_FILE</tt> - Each file is considered a separate
--   document. Use this option when you are processing large documents,
--   such as newspaper articles or scientific papers.</li>
--   <li><tt>ONE_DOC_PER_LINE</tt> - Each line in a file is considered a
--   separate document. Use this option when you are processing many short
--   documents, such as text messages.</li>
--   </ul>
inputDataConfig_inputFormat :: Lens' InputDataConfig (Maybe InputFormat)

-- | The Amazon S3 URI for the input data. The URI must be in same region
--   as the API endpoint that you are calling. The URI can point to a
--   single input file or it can provide the prefix for a collection of
--   data files.
--   
--   For example, if you use the URI <tt>S3://bucketName/prefix</tt>, if
--   the prefix is a single file, Amazon Comprehend uses that file as
--   input. If more than one file begins with the prefix, Amazon Comprehend
--   uses all of them as input.
inputDataConfig_s3Uri :: Lens' InputDataConfig Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.InputDataConfig.InputDataConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.InputDataConfig.InputDataConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.InputDataConfig.InputDataConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.InputDataConfig.InputDataConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.InputDataConfig.InputDataConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.InputDataConfig.InputDataConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.InputDataConfig.InputDataConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.InputDataConfig.InputDataConfig


module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityRecognizerDocuments

-- | Describes the training documents submitted with an entity recognizer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEntityRecognizerDocuments</a> smart constructor.
data EntityRecognizerDocuments
EntityRecognizerDocuments' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe InputFormat -> Text -> EntityRecognizerDocuments

-- | Specifies the Amazon S3 location where the test documents for an
--   entity recognizer are located. The URI must be in the same AWS Region
--   as the API endpoint that you are calling.
[$sel:testS3Uri:EntityRecognizerDocuments'] :: EntityRecognizerDocuments -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies how the text in an input file should be processed. This is
--   optional, and the default is ONE_DOC_PER_LINE. ONE_DOC_PER_FILE - Each
--   file is considered a separate document. Use this option when you are
--   processing large documents, such as newspaper articles or scientific
--   papers. ONE_DOC_PER_LINE - Each line in a file is considered a
--   separate document. Use this option when you are processing many short
--   documents, such as text messages.
[$sel:inputFormat:EntityRecognizerDocuments'] :: EntityRecognizerDocuments -> Maybe InputFormat

-- | Specifies the Amazon S3 location where the training documents for an
--   entity recognizer are located. The URI must be in the same region as
--   the API endpoint that you are calling.
[$sel:s3Uri:EntityRecognizerDocuments'] :: EntityRecognizerDocuments -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EntityRecognizerDocuments</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:testS3Uri:EntityRecognizerDocuments'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerDocuments_testS3Uri</a> - Specifies the Amazon S3
--   location where the test documents for an entity recognizer are
--   located. The URI must be in the same AWS Region as the API endpoint
--   that you are calling.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputFormat:EntityRecognizerDocuments'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerDocuments_inputFormat</a> - Specifies how the text
--   in an input file should be processed. This is optional, and the
--   default is ONE_DOC_PER_LINE. ONE_DOC_PER_FILE - Each file is
--   considered a separate document. Use this option when you are
--   processing large documents, such as newspaper articles or scientific
--   papers. ONE_DOC_PER_LINE - Each line in a file is considered a
--   separate document. Use this option when you are processing many short
--   documents, such as text messages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Uri:EntityRecognizerDocuments'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerDocuments_s3Uri</a> - Specifies the Amazon S3
--   location where the training documents for an entity recognizer are
--   located. The URI must be in the same region as the API endpoint that
--   you are calling.
newEntityRecognizerDocuments :: Text -> EntityRecognizerDocuments

-- | Specifies the Amazon S3 location where the test documents for an
--   entity recognizer are located. The URI must be in the same AWS Region
--   as the API endpoint that you are calling.
entityRecognizerDocuments_testS3Uri :: Lens' EntityRecognizerDocuments (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies how the text in an input file should be processed. This is
--   optional, and the default is ONE_DOC_PER_LINE. ONE_DOC_PER_FILE - Each
--   file is considered a separate document. Use this option when you are
--   processing large documents, such as newspaper articles or scientific
--   papers. ONE_DOC_PER_LINE - Each line in a file is considered a
--   separate document. Use this option when you are processing many short
--   documents, such as text messages.
entityRecognizerDocuments_inputFormat :: Lens' EntityRecognizerDocuments (Maybe InputFormat)

-- | Specifies the Amazon S3 location where the training documents for an
--   entity recognizer are located. The URI must be in the same region as
--   the API endpoint that you are calling.
entityRecognizerDocuments_s3Uri :: Lens' EntityRecognizerDocuments Text

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EntityRecognizerDocuments.EntityRecognizerDocuments

module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EventsDetectionJobFilter

-- | Provides information for filtering a list of event detection jobs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventsDetectionJobFilter</a> smart constructor.
data EventsDetectionJobFilter
EventsDetectionJobFilter' :: Maybe JobStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> EventsDetectionJobFilter

-- | Filters the list of jobs based on job status. Returns only jobs with
--   the specified status.
[$sel:jobStatus:EventsDetectionJobFilter'] :: EventsDetectionJobFilter -> Maybe JobStatus

-- | Filters the list of jobs based on the time that the job was submitted
--   for processing. Returns only jobs submitted before the specified time.
--   Jobs are returned in ascending order, oldest to newest.
[$sel:submitTimeBefore:EventsDetectionJobFilter'] :: EventsDetectionJobFilter -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Filters the list of jobs based on the time that the job was submitted
--   for processing. Returns only jobs submitted after the specified time.
--   Jobs are returned in descending order, newest to oldest.
[$sel:submitTimeAfter:EventsDetectionJobFilter'] :: EventsDetectionJobFilter -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Filters on the name of the events detection job.
[$sel:jobName:EventsDetectionJobFilter'] :: EventsDetectionJobFilter -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EventsDetectionJobFilter</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobStatus:EventsDetectionJobFilter'</a>,
--   <a>eventsDetectionJobFilter_jobStatus</a> - Filters the list of jobs
--   based on job status. Returns only jobs with the specified status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:submitTimeBefore:EventsDetectionJobFilter'</a>,
--   <a>eventsDetectionJobFilter_submitTimeBefore</a> - Filters the list of
--   jobs based on the time that the job was submitted for processing.
--   Returns only jobs submitted before the specified time. Jobs are
--   returned in ascending order, oldest to newest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:submitTimeAfter:EventsDetectionJobFilter'</a>,
--   <a>eventsDetectionJobFilter_submitTimeAfter</a> - Filters the list of
--   jobs based on the time that the job was submitted for processing.
--   Returns only jobs submitted after the specified time. Jobs are
--   returned in descending order, newest to oldest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobName:EventsDetectionJobFilter'</a>,
--   <a>eventsDetectionJobFilter_jobName</a> - Filters on the name of the
--   events detection job.
newEventsDetectionJobFilter :: EventsDetectionJobFilter

-- | Filters the list of jobs based on job status. Returns only jobs with
--   the specified status.
eventsDetectionJobFilter_jobStatus :: Lens' EventsDetectionJobFilter (Maybe JobStatus)

-- | Filters the list of jobs based on the time that the job was submitted
--   for processing. Returns only jobs submitted before the specified time.
--   Jobs are returned in ascending order, oldest to newest.
eventsDetectionJobFilter_submitTimeBefore :: Lens' EventsDetectionJobFilter (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Filters the list of jobs based on the time that the job was submitted
--   for processing. Returns only jobs submitted after the specified time.
--   Jobs are returned in descending order, newest to oldest.
eventsDetectionJobFilter_submitTimeAfter :: Lens' EventsDetectionJobFilter (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Filters on the name of the events detection job.
eventsDetectionJobFilter_jobName :: Lens' EventsDetectionJobFilter (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EventsDetectionJobFilter.EventsDetectionJobFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EventsDetectionJobFilter.EventsDetectionJobFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EventsDetectionJobFilter.EventsDetectionJobFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.EventsDetectionJobFilter.EventsDetectionJobFilter

module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.KeyPhrase

-- | Describes a key noun phrase.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKeyPhrase</a> smart constructor.
data KeyPhrase
KeyPhrase' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> KeyPhrase

-- | A character offset in the input text where the key phrase ends. The
--   offset returns the position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A
--   <tt>code point</tt> is the abstract character from a particular
--   graphical representation. For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character
--   maps to a single code point.
[$sel:endOffset:KeyPhrase'] :: KeyPhrase -> Maybe Int

-- | The level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of
--   the detection.
[$sel:score:KeyPhrase'] :: KeyPhrase -> Maybe Double

-- | The text of a key noun phrase.
[$sel:text:KeyPhrase'] :: KeyPhrase -> Maybe Text

-- | A character offset in the input text that shows where the key phrase
--   begins (the first character is at position 0). The offset returns the
--   position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A <i>code point</i>
--   is the abstract character from a particular graphical representation.
--   For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character maps to a single code point.
[$sel:beginOffset:KeyPhrase'] :: KeyPhrase -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>KeyPhrase</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endOffset:KeyPhrase'</a>, <a>keyPhrase_endOffset</a> - A
--   character offset in the input text where the key phrase ends. The
--   offset returns the position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A
--   <tt>code point</tt> is the abstract character from a particular
--   graphical representation. For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character
--   maps to a single code point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:score:KeyPhrase'</a>, <a>keyPhrase_score</a> - The level of
--   confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of the
--   detection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:text:KeyPhrase'</a>, <a>keyPhrase_text</a> - The text of a key
--   noun phrase.
--   
--   <a>$sel:beginOffset:KeyPhrase'</a>, <a>keyPhrase_beginOffset</a> - A
--   character offset in the input text that shows where the key phrase
--   begins (the first character is at position 0). The offset returns the
--   position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A <i>code point</i>
--   is the abstract character from a particular graphical representation.
--   For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character maps to a single code point.
newKeyPhrase :: KeyPhrase

-- | A character offset in the input text where the key phrase ends. The
--   offset returns the position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A
--   <tt>code point</tt> is the abstract character from a particular
--   graphical representation. For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character
--   maps to a single code point.
keyPhrase_endOffset :: Lens' KeyPhrase (Maybe Int)

-- | The level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of
--   the detection.
keyPhrase_score :: Lens' KeyPhrase (Maybe Double)

-- | The text of a key noun phrase.
keyPhrase_text :: Lens' KeyPhrase (Maybe Text)

-- | A character offset in the input text that shows where the key phrase
--   begins (the first character is at position 0). The offset returns the
--   position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A <i>code point</i>
--   is the abstract character from a particular graphical representation.
--   For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character maps to a single code point.
keyPhrase_beginOffset :: Lens' KeyPhrase (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.KeyPhrase.KeyPhrase
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.KeyPhrase.KeyPhrase
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.KeyPhrase.KeyPhrase
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.KeyPhrase.KeyPhrase
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.KeyPhrase.KeyPhrase
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.KeyPhrase.KeyPhrase
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.KeyPhrase.KeyPhrase


module Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.BatchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult

-- | The result of calling the operation. The operation returns one object
--   for each document that is successfully processed by the operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBatchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult</a> smart
--   constructor.
data BatchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult
BatchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult' :: Maybe [KeyPhrase] -> Maybe Int -> BatchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult

-- | One or more KeyPhrase objects, one for each key phrase detected in the
--   document.
[$sel:keyPhrases:BatchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult'] :: BatchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult -> Maybe [KeyPhrase]

-- | The zero-based index of the document in the input list.
[$sel:index:BatchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult'] :: BatchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>BatchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyPhrases:BatchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult'</a>,
--   <a>batchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult_keyPhrases</a> - One or more
--   KeyPhrase objects, one for each key phrase detected in the document.
--   
--   <a>$sel:index:BatchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult'</a>,
--   <a>batchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult_index</a> - The zero-based index of
--   the document in the input list.
newBatchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult :: BatchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult

-- | One or more KeyPhrase objects, one for each key phrase detected in the
--   document.
batchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult_keyPhrases :: Lens' BatchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult (Maybe [KeyPhrase])

-- | The zero-based index of the document in the input list.
batchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult_index :: Lens' BatchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.BatchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult.BatchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Comprehend.Types.BatchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult.BatchDetectKeyPhrasesItemResult
