-- | An augmented manifest file that provides training data for your custom
--   model. An augmented manifest file is a labeled dataset that is
--   produced by Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAugmentedManifestsListItem</a> smart constructor.
data AugmentedManifestsListItem
AugmentedManifestsListItem' :: Maybe AugmentedManifestsDocumentTypeFormat -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Split -> Text -> [Text] -> AugmentedManifestsListItem

-- | Create a value of <a>AugmentedManifestsListItem</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:documentType:AugmentedManifestsListItem'</a>,
--   <a>augmentedManifestsListItem_documentType</a> - The type of augmented
--   manifest. PlainTextDocument or SemiStructuredDocument. If you don't
--   specify, the default is PlainTextDocument.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PLAIN_TEXT_DOCUMENT</tt> A document type that represents any
--   unicode text that is encoded in UTF-8.</li>
--   <li><tt>SEMI_STRUCTURED_DOCUMENT</tt> A document type with positional
--   and structural context, like a PDF. For training with Amazon
--   Comprehend, only PDFs are supported. For inference, Amazon Comprehend
--   support PDFs, DOCX and TXT.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceDocumentsS3Uri:AugmentedManifestsListItem'</a>,
--   <a>augmentedManifestsListItem_sourceDocumentsS3Uri</a> - The S3 prefix
--   to the source files (PDFs) that are referred to in the augmented
--   manifest file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:annotationDataS3Uri:AugmentedManifestsListItem'</a>,
--   <a>augmentedManifestsListItem_annotationDataS3Uri</a> - The S3 prefix
--   to the annotation files that are referred in the augmented manifest
--   file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:split:AugmentedManifestsListItem'</a>,
--   <a>augmentedManifestsListItem_split</a> - The purpose of the data
--   you've provided in the augmented manifest. You can either train or
--   test this data. If you don't specify, the default is train.
--   
--   TRAIN - all of the documents in the manifest will be used for
--   training. If no test documents are provided, Amazon Comprehend will
--   automatically reserve a portion of the training documents for testing.
--   
--   TEST - all of the documents in the manifest will be used for testing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Uri:AugmentedManifestsListItem'</a>,
--   <a>augmentedManifestsListItem_s3Uri</a> - The Amazon S3 location of
--   the augmented manifest file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeNames:AugmentedManifestsListItem'</a>,
--   <a>augmentedManifestsListItem_attributeNames</a> - The JSON attribute
--   that contains the annotations for your training documents. The number
--   of attribute names that you specify depends on whether your augmented
--   manifest file is the output of a single labeling job or a chained
--   labeling job.
--   
--   If your file is the output of a single labeling job, specify the
--   LabelAttributeName key that was used when the job was created in
--   Ground Truth.
--   
--   If your file is the output of a chained labeling job, specify the
--   LabelAttributeName key for one or more jobs in the chain. Each
--   LabelAttributeName key provides the annotations from an individual
--   job.
newAugmentedManifestsListItem :: Text -> AugmentedManifestsListItem

-- | The result of calling the operation. The operation returns one object
--   for each document that is successfully processed by the operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult</a> smart

data BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult

--   document.

--   index of the document in the input list.

-- | Describes the result metrics for the test data associated with an
--   documentation classifier.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClassifierEvaluationMetrics</a> smart constructor.
data ClassifierEvaluationMetrics
ClassifierEvaluationMetrics' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> ClassifierEvaluationMetrics

-- | Create a value of <a>ClassifierEvaluationMetrics</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:f1Score:ClassifierEvaluationMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>classifierEvaluationMetrics_f1Score</a> - A measure of how accurate
--   the classifier results are for the test data. It is derived from the
--   <tt>Precision</tt> and <tt>Recall</tt> values. The <tt>F1Score</tt> is
--   the harmonic average of the two scores. The highest score is 1, and
--   the worst score is 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:microRecall:ClassifierEvaluationMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>classifierEvaluationMetrics_microRecall</a> - A measure of how
--   complete the classifier results are for the test data. High recall
--   means that the classifier returned most of the relevant results.
--   Specifically, this indicates how many of the correct categories in the
--   text that the model can predict. It is a percentage of correct
--   categories in the text that can found. Instead of averaging the recall
--   scores of all labels (as with Recall), micro Recall is based on the
--   overall score of all recall scores added together.
--   
--   <a>$sel:microPrecision:ClassifierEvaluationMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>classifierEvaluationMetrics_microPrecision</a> - A measure of the
--   usefulness of the recognizer results in the test data. High precision
--   means that the recognizer returned substantially more relevant results
--   than irrelevant ones. Unlike the Precision metric which comes from
--   averaging the precision of all available labels, this is based on the
--   overall score of all precision scores added together.
--   
--   <a>$sel:precision:ClassifierEvaluationMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>classifierEvaluationMetrics_precision</a> - A measure of the
--   usefulness of the classifier results in the test data. High precision
--   means that the classifier returned substantially more relevant results
--   than irrelevant ones.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accuracy:ClassifierEvaluationMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>classifierEvaluationMetrics_accuracy</a> - The fraction of the
--   labels that were correct recognized. It is computed by dividing the
--   number of labels in the test documents that were correctly recognized
--   by the total number of labels in the test documents.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hammingLoss:ClassifierEvaluationMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>classifierEvaluationMetrics_hammingLoss</a> - Indicates the
--   fraction of labels that are incorrectly predicted. Also seen as the
--   fraction of wrong labels compared to the total number of labels.
--   Scores closer to zero are better.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recall:ClassifierEvaluationMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>classifierEvaluationMetrics_recall</a> - A measure of how complete
--   the classifier results are for the test data. High recall means that
--   the classifier returned most of the relevant results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:microF1Score:ClassifierEvaluationMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>classifierEvaluationMetrics_microF1Score</a> - A measure of how
--   accurate the classifier results are for the test data. It is a
--   combination of the <tt>Micro Precision</tt> and <tt>Micro Recall</tt>
--   values. The <tt>Micro F1Score</tt> is the harmonic mean of the two
--   scores. The highest score is 1, and the worst score is 0.
newClassifierEvaluationMetrics :: ClassifierEvaluationMetrics

-- | Provides information about a document classifier.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newClassifierMetadata</a> smart constructor.
data ClassifierMetadata
ClassifierMetadata' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ClassifierEvaluationMetrics -> ClassifierMetadata

-- | Create a value of <a>ClassifierMetadata</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfLabels:ClassifierMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>classifierMetadata_numberOfLabels</a> - The number of labels in the
--   input data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfTestDocuments:ClassifierMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>classifierMetadata_numberOfTestDocuments</a> - The number of
--   documents in the input data that were used to test the classifier.
--   Typically this is 10 to 20 percent of the input documents, up to
--   10,000 documents.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfTrainedDocuments:ClassifierMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>classifierMetadata_numberOfTrainedDocuments</a> - The number of
--   documents in the input data that were used to train the classifier.
--   Typically this is 80 to 90 percent of the input documents.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluationMetrics:ClassifierMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>classifierMetadata_evaluationMetrics</a> - Describes the result
--   metrics for the test data associated with an documentation classifier.
newClassifierMetadata :: ClassifierMetadata

-- | Create a value of <a>DocumentClassificationJobProperties</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   parameters for a private Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) containing the
--   resources you are using for your document classification job. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon VPC</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputDataConfig:DocumentClassificationJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassificationJobProperties_inputDataConfig</a> - The input
--   data configuration that you supplied when you created the document
--   classification job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:DocumentClassificationJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassificationJobProperties_message</a> - A description of
--   the status of the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobStatus:DocumentClassificationJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassificationJobProperties_jobStatus</a> - The current
--   status of the document classification job. If the status is
--   <tt>FAILED</tt>, the <tt>Message</tt> field shows the reason for the
--   failure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputDataConfig:DocumentClassificationJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassificationJobProperties_outputDataConfig</a> - The
--   output data configuration that you supplied when you created the
--   document classification job.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:documentClassifierArn:DocumentClassificationJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassificationJobProperties_documentClassifierArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the document classifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:DocumentClassificationJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassificationJobProperties_endTime</a> - The time that the
--   document classification job completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobArn:DocumentClassificationJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassificationJobProperties_jobArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the document classification job. It is a
--   unique, fully qualified identifier for the job. It includes the AWS
--   account, Region, and the job ID. The format of the ARN is as follows:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:&lt;partition&gt;:comprehend:&lt;region&gt;:&lt;account-id&gt;:document-classification-job/&lt;job-id&gt;
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following is an example job ARN:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:comprehend:us-west-2:111122223333:document-classification-job/1234abcd12ab34cd56ef1234567890ab
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeKmsKeyId:DocumentClassificationJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassificationJobProperties_volumeKmsKeyId</a> - ID for the
--   AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to
--   encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute
--   instance(s) that process the analysis job. The VolumeKmsKeyId can be
--   either of the following formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: <tt>"1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:submitTime:DocumentClassificationJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassificationJobProperties_submitTime</a> - The time that
--   the document classification job was submitted for processing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobName:DocumentClassificationJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassificationJobProperties_jobName</a> - The name that you
--   assigned to the document classification job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:DocumentClassificationJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassificationJobProperties_dataAccessRoleArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS identity and Access Management
--   (IAM) role that grants Amazon Comprehend read access to your input
--   data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:DocumentClassificationJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassificationJobProperties_jobId</a> - The identifier
--   assigned to the document classification job.
newDocumentClassificationJobProperties :: DocumentClassificationJobProperties

-- | The input properties for training a document classifier.
--   
--   For more information on how the input file is formatted, see
--   how-document-classification-training-data.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDocumentClassifierInputDataConfig</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DocumentClassifierInputDataConfig
DocumentClassifierInputDataConfig' :: Maybe [AugmentedManifestsListItem] -> Maybe DocumentClassifierDataFormat -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DocumentClassifierInputDataConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>DocumentClassifierInputDataConfig</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:augmentedManifests:DocumentClassifierInputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierInputDataConfig_augmentedManifests</a> - A list
--   of augmented manifest files that provide training data for your custom
--   model. An augmented manifest file is a labeled dataset that is
--   produced by Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth.
--   
--   This parameter is required if you set <tt>DataFormat</tt> to
--   <tt>AUGMENTED_MANIFEST</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataFormat:DocumentClassifierInputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierInputDataConfig_dataFormat</a> - The format of
--   your training data:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPREHEND_CSV</tt>: A two-column CSV file, where labels are
--   provided in the first column, and documents are provided in the
--   second. If you use this value, you must provide the <tt>S3Uri</tt>
--   parameter in your request.</li>
--   <li><tt>AUGMENTED_MANIFEST</tt>: A labeled dataset that is produced by
--   Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth. This file is in JSON lines format. Each
--   line is a complete JSON object that contains a training document and
--   its associated labels.If you use this value, you must provide the
--   <tt>AugmentedManifests</tt> parameter in your request.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify a value, Amazon Comprehend uses
--   <tt>COMPREHEND_CSV</tt> as the default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:testS3Uri:DocumentClassifierInputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierInputDataConfig_testS3Uri</a> - The Amazon S3 URI
--   for the input data. The Amazon S3 bucket must be in the same AWS
--   Region as the API endpoint that you are calling. The URI can point to
--   a single input file or it can provide the prefix for a collection of
--   input files.
--   
--   <a>$sel:labelDelimiter:DocumentClassifierInputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierInputDataConfig_labelDelimiter</a> - Indicates
--   the delimiter used to separate each label for training a multi-label
--   classifier. The default delimiter between labels is a pipe (|). You
--   can use a different character as a delimiter (if it's an allowed
--   character) by specifying it under Delimiter for labels. If the
--   training documents use a delimiter other than the default or the
--   delimiter you specify, the labels on that line will be combined to
--   make a single unique label, such as LABELLABELLABEL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Uri:DocumentClassifierInputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierInputDataConfig_s3Uri</a> - The Amazon S3 URI for
--   the input data. The S3 bucket must be in the same region as the API
--   endpoint that you are calling. The URI can point to a single input
--   file or it can provide the prefix for a collection of input files.
--   
--   For example, if you use the URI <tt>S3://bucketName/prefix</tt>, if
--   the prefix is a single file, Amazon Comprehend uses that file as
--   input. If more than one file begins with the prefix, Amazon Comprehend
--   uses all of them as input.
--   
--   This parameter is required if you set <tt>DataFormat</tt> to
--   <tt>COMPREHEND_CSV</tt>.
newDocumentClassifierInputDataConfig :: DocumentClassifierInputDataConfig

-- | Provides output results configuration parameters for custom classifier
--   jobs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig
DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierOutputDataConfig_kmsKeyId</a> - ID for the AWS
--   Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to
--   encrypt the output results from an analysis job. The KmsKeyId can be
--   one of the following formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: <tt>"1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   <li>KMS Key Alias: <tt>"alias/ExampleAlias"</tt></li>
--   <li>ARN of a KMS Key Alias:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias"</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Uri:DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierOutputDataConfig_s3Uri</a> - When you use the
--   <tt>OutputDataConfig</tt> object while creating a custom classifier,
--   you specify the Amazon S3 location where you want to write the
--   confusion matrix. The URI must be in the same region as the API
--   endpoint that you are calling. The location is used as the prefix for
--   the actual location of this output file.
--   
--   When the custom classifier job is finished, the service creates the
--   output file in a directory specific to the job. The <tt>S3Uri</tt>
--   field contains the location of the output file, called
--   <tt>output.tar.gz</tt>. It is a compressed archive that contains the
--   confusion matrix.
newDocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig :: DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig

-- | Provides information about a document classifier.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDocumentClassifierProperties</a> smart constructor.
data DocumentClassifierProperties
DocumentClassifierProperties' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe VpcConfig -> Maybe ModelStatus -> Maybe DocumentClassifierInputDataConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DocumentClassifierMode -> Maybe DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (Sensitive ClassifierMetadata) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> DocumentClassifierProperties

-- | Create a value of <a>DocumentClassifierProperties</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:DocumentClassifierProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierProperties_languageCode</a> - The language code
--   for the language of the documents that the classifier was trained on.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcConfig:DocumentClassifierProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierProperties_vpcConfig</a> - Configuration
--   parameters for a private Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) containing the
--   resources you are using for your custom classifier. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon VPC</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DocumentClassifierProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierProperties_status</a> - The status of the
--   document classifier. If the status is <tt>TRAINED</tt> the classifier
--   is ready to use. If the status is <tt>FAILED</tt> you can see
--   additional information about why the classifier wasn't trained in the
--   <tt>Message</tt> field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputDataConfig:DocumentClassifierProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierProperties_inputDataConfig</a> - The input data
--   configuration that you supplied when you created the document
--   classifier for training.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:DocumentClassifierProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierProperties_message</a> - Additional information
--   about the status of the classifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mode:DocumentClassifierProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierProperties_mode</a> - Indicates the mode in which
--   the specific classifier was trained. This also indicates the format of
--   input documents and the format of the confusion matrix. Each
--   classifier can only be trained in one mode and this cannot be changed
--   once the classifier is trained.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputDataConfig:DocumentClassifierProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierProperties_outputDataConfig</a> - Provides output
--   results configuration parameters for custom classifier jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:documentClassifierArn:DocumentClassifierProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierProperties_documentClassifierArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the document classifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionName:DocumentClassifierProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierProperties_versionName</a> - The version name
--   that you assigned to the document classifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:DocumentClassifierProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierProperties_endTime</a> - The time that training
--   the document classifier completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:classifierMetadata:DocumentClassifierProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierProperties_classifierMetadata</a> - Information
--   about the document classifier, including the number of documents used
--   for training the classifier, the number of documents used for test the
--   classifier, and an accuracy rating.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeKmsKeyId:DocumentClassifierProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierProperties_volumeKmsKeyId</a> - ID for the AWS
--   Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to
--   encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute
--   instance(s) that process the analysis job. The VolumeKmsKeyId can be
--   either of the following formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: <tt>"1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:submitTime:DocumentClassifierProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierProperties_submitTime</a> - The time that the
--   document classifier was submitted for training.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelKmsKeyId:DocumentClassifierProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierProperties_modelKmsKeyId</a> - ID for the AWS Key
--   Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt
--   trained custom models. The ModelKmsKeyId can be either of the
--   following formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: <tt>"1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:trainingStartTime:DocumentClassifierProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierProperties_trainingStartTime</a> - Indicates the
--   time when the training starts on documentation classifiers. You are
--   billed for the time interval between this time and the value of
--   TrainingEndTime.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:DocumentClassifierProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierProperties_dataAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Management (IAM) role that
--   grants Amazon Comprehend read access to your input data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trainingEndTime:DocumentClassifierProperties'</a>,
--   <a>documentClassifierProperties_trainingEndTime</a> - The time that
--   training of the document classifier was completed. Indicates the time
--   when the training completes on documentation classifiers. You are
--   billed for the time interval between this time and the value of
--   TrainingStartTime.
newDocumentClassifierProperties :: DocumentClassifierProperties

-- | The input properties for a topic detection job.
--

data DocumentReaderConfig
DocumentReaderConfig' :: Maybe (NonEmpty DocumentReadFeatureTypes) -> Maybe DocumentReadMode -> DocumentReadAction -> DocumentReaderConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>DocumentReaderConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:featureTypes:DocumentReaderConfig'</a>,
--   <a>documentReaderConfig_featureTypes</a> - Specifies how the text in
--   an input file should be processed:
--   
--   <a>$sel:documentReadMode:DocumentReaderConfig'</a>,
--   <a>documentReaderConfig_documentReadMode</a> - This enum field
--   provides two values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>SERVICE_DEFAULT</tt> - use service defaults for Document
--   reading. For Digital PDF it would mean using an internal parser
--   instead of Textract APIs</li>
--   <li><tt>FORCE_DOCUMENT_READ_ACTION</tt> - Always use specified action
--   for DocumentReadAction, including Digital PDF.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:documentReadAction:DocumentReaderConfig'</a>,
--   <a>documentReaderConfig_documentReadAction</a> - This enum field will
--   start with two values which will apply to PDFs:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TEXTRACT_DETECT_DOCUMENT_TEXT</tt> - The service calls
--   DetectDocumentText for PDF documents per page.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEXTRACT_ANALYZE_DOCUMENT</tt> - The service calls
--   AnalyzeDocument for PDF documents per page.</li>
--   </ul>
newDocumentReaderConfig :: DocumentReadAction -> DocumentReaderConfig

--   all optional fields omitted.

--   containing the resources you are using for your dominant language
--   detection job. For more information, see <a>Amazon VPC</a>.
--

--   <a>dominantLanguageDetectionJobProperties_inputDataConfig</a> - The
--   input data configuration that you supplied when you created the
--   dominant language detection job.

--   <a>dominantLanguageDetectionJobProperties_jobStatus</a> - The current
--   status of the dominant language detection job. If the status is

--   the dominant language detection job completed.

--   <a>$sel:jobArn:DominantLanguageDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>dominantLanguageDetectionJobProperties_jobArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the dominant language detection job. It is a
--   unique, fully qualified identifier for the job. It includes the AWS
--   account, Region, and the job ID. The format of the ARN is as follows:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:&lt;partition&gt;:comprehend:&lt;region&gt;:&lt;account-id&gt;:dominant-language-detection-job/&lt;job-id&gt;
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following is an example job ARN:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:comprehend:us-west-2:111122223333:dominant-language-detection-job/1234abcd12ab34cd56ef1234567890ab
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeKmsKeyId:DominantLanguageDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>dominantLanguageDetectionJobProperties_volumeKmsKeyId</a> - ID for
--   the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses
--   to encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute
--   instance(s) that process the analysis job. The VolumeKmsKeyId can be
--   either of the following formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: <tt>"1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--

--   that the dominant language detection job was submitted for processing.
--

--

--   assigned to the dominant language detection job.
newDominantLanguageDetectionJobProperties :: DominantLanguageDetectionJobProperties

-- | The filter used to determine which endpoints are returned. You can
--   filter jobs on their name, model, status, or the date and time that
--   they were created. You can only set one filter at a time.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointFilter</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointFilter
EndpointFilter' :: Maybe EndpointStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> EndpointFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:EndpointFilter'</a>, <a>endpointFilter_status</a> -
--   Specifies the status of the endpoint being returned. Possible values
--   are: Creating, Ready, Updating, Deleting, Failed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTimeBefore:EndpointFilter'</a>,
--   <a>endpointFilter_creationTimeBefore</a> - Specifies a date before
--   which the returned endpoint or endpoints were created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelArn:EndpointFilter'</a>, <a>endpointFilter_modelArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the model to which the endpoint is
--   attached.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTimeAfter:EndpointFilter'</a>,
--   <a>endpointFilter_creationTimeAfter</a> - Specifies a date after which
--   the returned endpoint or endpoints were created.
newEndpointFilter :: EndpointFilter

-- | Specifies information about the specified endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointProperties</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointProperties
EndpointProperties' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe EndpointStatus -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EndpointProperties

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointProperties</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentInferenceUnits:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_currentInferenceUnits</a> - The number of
--   inference units currently used by the model using this endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_creationTime</a> - The creation date and time of
--   the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_status</a> - Specifies the status of the
--   endpoint. Because the endpoint updates and creation are asynchronous,
--   so customers will need to wait for the endpoint to be <tt>Ready</tt>
--   status before making inference requests.
--   
--   <a>$sel:desiredInferenceUnits:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_desiredInferenceUnits</a> - The desired number
--   of inference units to be used by the model using this endpoint. Each
--   inference unit represents of a throughput of 100 characters per
--   second.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_message</a> - Specifies a reason for failure in
--   cases of <tt>Failed</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:desiredDataAccessRoleArn:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_desiredDataAccessRoleArn</a> - Data access role
--   ARN to use in case the new model is encrypted with a customer KMS key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelArn:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_modelArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Number (ARN)
--   of the model to which the endpoint is attached.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedTime:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_lastModifiedTime</a> - The date and time that
--   the endpoint was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointArn:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_endpointArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Number
--   (ARN) of the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_dataAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the AWS identity and Access Management (IAM) role that grants
--   Amazon Comprehend read access to trained custom models encrypted with
--   a customer managed key (ModelKmsKeyId).
--   
--   <a>$sel:desiredModelArn:EndpointProperties'</a>,
--   <a>endpointProperties_desiredModelArn</a> - ARN of the new model to
--   use for updating an existing endpoint. This ARN is going to be
--   different from the model ARN when the update is in progress
newEndpointProperties :: EndpointProperties

-- | Provides information for filtering a list of dominant language
--   detection jobs. For more information, see the operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEntitiesDetectionJobFilter</a> smart constructor.
data EntitiesDetectionJobFilter
EntitiesDetectionJobFilter' :: Maybe JobStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> EntitiesDetectionJobFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>EntitiesDetectionJobFilter</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobStatus:EntitiesDetectionJobFilter'</a>,
--   <a>entitiesDetectionJobFilter_jobStatus</a> - Filters the list of jobs
--   based on job status. Returns only jobs with the specified status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:submitTimeBefore:EntitiesDetectionJobFilter'</a>,
--   <a>entitiesDetectionJobFilter_submitTimeBefore</a> - Filters the list
--   of jobs based on the time that the job was submitted for processing.
--   Returns only jobs submitted before the specified time. Jobs are
--   returned in ascending order, oldest to newest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:submitTimeAfter:EntitiesDetectionJobFilter'</a>,
--   <a>entitiesDetectionJobFilter_submitTimeAfter</a> - Filters the list
--   of jobs based on the time that the job was submitted for processing.
--   Returns only jobs submitted after the specified time. Jobs are
--   returned in descending order, newest to oldest.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobName:EntitiesDetectionJobFilter'</a>,
--   <a>entitiesDetectionJobFilter_jobName</a> - Filters on the name of the
--   job.
newEntitiesDetectionJobFilter :: EntitiesDetectionJobFilter

--   information, see <a>Amazon VPC</a>.

--   configuration that you supplied when you created the entities
--   detection job.

--   <a>entitiesDetectionJobProperties_message</a> - A description of the
--   status of a job.

--   <a>$sel:jobStatus:EntitiesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entitiesDetectionJobProperties_jobStatus</a> - The current status
--   of the entities detection job. If the status is <tt>FAILED</tt>, the
--   <tt>Message</tt> field shows the reason for the failure.

--   <a>entitiesDetectionJobProperties_outputDataConfig</a> - The output
--   data configuration that you supplied when you created the entities
--   detection job.

--   entities detection job completed

--   <a>entitiesDetectionJobProperties_jobArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the entities detection job. It is a unique, fully
--   qualified identifier for the job. It includes the AWS account, Region,
--   and the job ID. The format of the ARN is as follows:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:&lt;partition&gt;:comprehend:&lt;region&gt;:&lt;account-id&gt;:entities-detection-job/&lt;job-id&gt;
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following is an example job ARN:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:comprehend:us-west-2:111122223333:entities-detection-job/1234abcd12ab34cd56ef1234567890ab
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeKmsKeyId:EntitiesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entitiesDetectionJobProperties_volumeKmsKeyId</a> - ID for the AWS
--   Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to
--   encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute
--   instance(s) that process the analysis job. The VolumeKmsKeyId can be
--   either of the following formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: <tt>"1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:submitTime:EntitiesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entitiesDetectionJobProperties_submitTime</a> - The time that the
--   entities detection job was submitted for processing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityRecognizerArn:EntitiesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entitiesDetectionJobProperties_entityRecognizerArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the entity recognizer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobName:EntitiesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entitiesDetectionJobProperties_jobName</a> - The name that you
--   assigned the entities detection job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:EntitiesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entitiesDetectionJobProperties_dataAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) that gives Amazon Comprehend read access to your
--   input data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:EntitiesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entitiesDetectionJobProperties_jobId</a> - The identifier assigned
--   to the entities detection job.
newEntitiesDetectionJobProperties :: EntitiesDetectionJobProperties

-- | Provides information about an entity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEntity</a> smart constructor.
data Entity
Entity' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe EntityType -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Entity

-- | Create a value of <a>Entity</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endOffset:Entity'</a>, <a>entity_endOffset</a> - A character
--   offset in the input text that shows where the entity ends. The offset
--   returns the position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A <i>code
--   point</i> is the abstract character from a particular graphical
--   representation. For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character maps to a
--   single code point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Entity'</a>, <a>entity_type</a> - The entity's type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:score:Entity'</a>, <a>entity_score</a> - The level of
--   confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of the
--   detection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:text:Entity'</a>, <a>entity_text</a> - The text of the entity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:beginOffset:Entity'</a>, <a>entity_beginOffset</a> - A
--   character offset in the input text that shows where the entity begins
--   (the first character is at position 0). The offset returns the
--   position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A <i>code point</i>
--   is the abstract character from a particular graphical representation.
--   For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character maps to a single code point.
newEntity :: Entity

--   in an input file should be processed. This is optional, and the
--   default is ONE_DOC_PER_LINE. ONE_DOC_PER_FILE - Each file is
--   considered a separate document. Use this option when you are
--   processing large documents, such as newspaper articles or scientific
--   papers. ONE_DOC_PER_LINE - Each line in a file is considered a

--   documents, such as text messages.

-- | Detailed information about the accuracy of an entity recognizer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics</a> smart
--   constructor.
data EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics
EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics

-- | Create a value of <a>EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:f1Score:EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics_f1Score</a> - A measure of how
--   accurate the recognizer results are for the test data. It is derived
--   from the <tt>Precision</tt> and <tt>Recall</tt> values. The
--   <tt>F1Score</tt> is the harmonic average of the two scores. The
--   highest score is 1, and the worst score is 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:precision:EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics_precision</a> - A measure of the
--   usefulness of the recognizer results in the test data. High precision
--   means that the recognizer returned substantially more relevant results
--   than irrelevant ones.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recall:EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics_recall</a> - A measure of how
--   complete the recognizer results are for the test data. High recall
--   means that the recognizer returned most of the relevant results.
newEntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics :: EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics

-- | Specifies the format and location of the input data.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEntityRecognizerInputDataConfig</a> smart
--   constructor.
data EntityRecognizerInputDataConfig
EntityRecognizerInputDataConfig' :: Maybe EntityRecognizerDocuments -> Maybe [AugmentedManifestsListItem] -> Maybe EntityRecognizerDataFormat -> Maybe EntityRecognizerAnnotations -> Maybe EntityRecognizerEntityList -> [EntityTypesListItem] -> EntityRecognizerInputDataConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>EntityRecognizerInputDataConfig</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:documents:EntityRecognizerInputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerInputDataConfig_documents</a> - The S3 location of
--   the folder that contains the training documents for your custom entity
--   recognizer.
--   
--   This parameter is required if you set <tt>DataFormat</tt> to
--   <tt>COMPREHEND_CSV</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:augmentedManifests:EntityRecognizerInputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerInputDataConfig_augmentedManifests</a> - A list of
--   augmented manifest files that provide training data for your custom
--   model. An augmented manifest file is a labeled dataset that is
--   produced by Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth.
--   
--   This parameter is required if you set <tt>DataFormat</tt> to
--   <tt>AUGMENTED_MANIFEST</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataFormat:EntityRecognizerInputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerInputDataConfig_dataFormat</a> - The format of your
--   training data:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPREHEND_CSV</tt>: A CSV file that supplements your training
--   documents. The CSV file contains information about the custom entities
--   that your trained model will detect. The required format of the file
--   depends on whether you are providing annotations or an entity list.If
--   you use this value, you must provide your CSV file by using either the
--   <tt>Annotations</tt> or <tt>EntityList</tt> parameters. You must
--   provide your training documents by using the <tt>Documents</tt>
--   parameter.</li>
--   <li><tt>AUGMENTED_MANIFEST</tt>: A labeled dataset that is produced by
--   Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth. This file is in JSON lines format. Each
--   line is a complete JSON object that contains a training document and
--   its labels. Each label annotates a named entity in the training
--   document.If you use this value, you must provide the
--   <tt>AugmentedManifests</tt> parameter in your request.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify a value, Amazon Comprehend uses
--   <tt>COMPREHEND_CSV</tt> as the default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:annotations:EntityRecognizerInputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerInputDataConfig_annotations</a> - The S3 location
--   of the CSV file that annotates your training documents.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityList:EntityRecognizerInputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerInputDataConfig_entityList</a> - The S3 location of
--   the CSV file that has the entity list for your custom entity
--   recognizer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityTypes:EntityRecognizerInputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerInputDataConfig_entityTypes</a> - The entity types
--   in the labeled training data that Amazon Comprehend uses to train the
--   custom entity recognizer. Any entity types that you don't specify are
--   ignored.
--   
--   A maximum of 25 entity types can be used at one time to train an
--   entity recognizer. Entity types must not contain the following invalid
--   characters: \n (line break), \\n (escaped line break), \r (carriage
--   return), \\r (escaped carriage return), \t (tab), \\t (escaped tab),
--   space, and , (comma).
newEntityRecognizerInputDataConfig :: EntityRecognizerInputDataConfig

--   recognizer. Typically this is 10 to 20 percent of the input documents.

--   recognizer. Typically this is 80 to 90 percent of the input documents.

-- | Describes information about an entity recognizer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEntityRecognizerProperties</a> smart constructor.
data EntityRecognizerProperties
EntityRecognizerProperties' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe VpcConfig -> Maybe ModelStatus -> Maybe EntityRecognizerInputDataConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (Sensitive EntityRecognizerMetadata) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> EntityRecognizerProperties

-- | Create a value of <a>EntityRecognizerProperties</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:EntityRecognizerProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerProperties_languageCode</a> - The language of the
--   input documents. All documents must be in the same language. Only
--   English ("en") is currently supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcConfig:EntityRecognizerProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerProperties_vpcConfig</a> - Configuration parameters
--   for a private Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) containing the resources you
--   are using for your custom entity recognizer. For more information, see
--   <a>Amazon VPC</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:EntityRecognizerProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerProperties_status</a> - Provides the status of the
--   entity recognizer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputDataConfig:EntityRecognizerProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerProperties_inputDataConfig</a> - The input data
--   properties of an entity recognizer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:EntityRecognizerProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerProperties_message</a> - A description of the
--   status of the recognizer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionName:EntityRecognizerProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerProperties_versionName</a> - The version name you
--   assigned to the entity recognizer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:EntityRecognizerProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerProperties_endTime</a> - The time that the
--   recognizer creation completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeKmsKeyId:EntityRecognizerProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerProperties_volumeKmsKeyId</a> - ID for the AWS Key
--   Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt
--   data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute instance(s) that
--   process the analysis job. The VolumeKmsKeyId can be either of the
--   following formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: <tt>"1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:submitTime:EntityRecognizerProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerProperties_submitTime</a> - The time that the
--   recognizer was submitted for processing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recognizerMetadata:EntityRecognizerProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerProperties_recognizerMetadata</a> - Provides
--   information about an entity recognizer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityRecognizerArn:EntityRecognizerProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerProperties_entityRecognizerArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the entity recognizer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:modelKmsKeyId:EntityRecognizerProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerProperties_modelKmsKeyId</a> - ID for the AWS Key
--   Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt
--   trained custom models. The ModelKmsKeyId can be either of the
--   following formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: <tt>"1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:trainingStartTime:EntityRecognizerProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerProperties_trainingStartTime</a> - The time that
--   training of the entity recognizer started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:EntityRecognizerProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerProperties_dataAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Management (IAM) role that
--   grants Amazon Comprehend read access to your input data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trainingEndTime:EntityRecognizerProperties'</a>,
--   <a>entityRecognizerProperties_trainingEndTime</a> - The time that
--   training of the entity recognizer was completed.
newEntityRecognizerProperties :: EntityRecognizerProperties

data EntityRecognizerSummary

-- | Detailed information about the accuracy of an entity recognizer for a
--   specific entity type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEntityTypesEvaluationMetrics</a> smart constructor.
data EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics
EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics

-- | Create a value of <a>EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:f1Score:EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>entityTypesEvaluationMetrics_f1Score</a> - A measure of how
--   accurate the recognizer results are for a specific entity type in the
--   test data. It is derived from the <tt>Precision</tt> and
--   <tt>Recall</tt> values. The <tt>F1Score</tt> is the harmonic average
--   of the two scores. The highest score is 1, and the worst score is 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:precision:EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>entityTypesEvaluationMetrics_precision</a> - A measure of the
--   usefulness of the recognizer results for a specific entity type in the
--   test data. High precision means that the recognizer returned
--   substantially more relevant results than irrelevant ones.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recall:EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>entityTypesEvaluationMetrics_recall</a> - A measure of how complete
--   the recognizer results are for a specific entity type in the test
--   data. High recall means that the recognizer returned most of the
--   relevant results.
newEntityTypesEvaluationMetrics :: EntityTypesEvaluationMetrics

-- | An entity type within a labeled training dataset that Amazon
--   Comprehend uses to train a custom entity recognizer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEntityTypesListItem</a> smart constructor.
data EntityTypesListItem
EntityTypesListItem' :: Text -> EntityTypesListItem

-- | Create a value of <a>EntityTypesListItem</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':EntityTypesListItem'</a>,
--   <a>entityTypesListItem_type</a> - An entity type within a labeled
--   training dataset that Amazon Comprehend uses to train a custom entity
--   recognizer.
--   
--   Entity types must not contain the following invalid characters: \n
--   (line break), \\n (escaped line break, \r (carriage return), \\r
--   (escaped carriage return), \t (tab), \\t (escaped tab), space, and ,
--   (comma).
newEntityTypesListItem :: Text -> EntityTypesListItem

-- | The input properties for an inference job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputDataConfig</a> smart constructor.
data InputDataConfig
InputDataConfig' :: Maybe DocumentReaderConfig -> Maybe InputFormat -> Text -> InputDataConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>InputDataConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:documentReaderConfig:InputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>inputDataConfig_documentReaderConfig</a> - The document reader
--   config field applies only for InputDataConfig of
--   StartEntitiesDetectionJob.
--   
--   Use DocumentReaderConfig to provide specifications about how you want
--   your inference documents read. Currently it applies for PDF documents
--   in StartEntitiesDetectionJob custom inference.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputFormat:InputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>inputDataConfig_inputFormat</a> - Specifies how the text in an
--   input file should be processed:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ONE_DOC_PER_FILE</tt> - Each file is considered a separate
--   document. Use this option when you are processing large documents,
--   such as newspaper articles or scientific papers.</li>
--   <li><tt>ONE_DOC_PER_LINE</tt> - Each line in a file is considered a
--   separate document. Use this option when you are processing many short
--   documents, such as text messages.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Uri:InputDataConfig'</a>, <a>inputDataConfig_s3Uri</a> - The
--   Amazon S3 URI for the input data. The URI must be in same region as
--   the API endpoint that you are calling. The URI can point to a single
--   input file or it can provide the prefix for a collection of data
--   files.
--   
--   For example, if you use the URI <tt>S3://bucketName/prefix</tt>, if
--   the prefix is a single file, Amazon Comprehend uses that file as
--   input. If more than one file begins with the prefix, Amazon Comprehend
--   uses all of them as input.
newInputDataConfig :: Text -> InputDataConfig

-- | Describes a key noun phrase.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKeyPhrase</a> smart constructor.
data KeyPhrase
KeyPhrase' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> KeyPhrase

-- | Create a value of <a>KeyPhrase</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endOffset:KeyPhrase'</a>, <a>keyPhrase_endOffset</a> - A
--   character offset in the input text where the key phrase ends. The
--   offset returns the position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A
--   <tt>code point</tt> is the abstract character from a particular
--   graphical representation. For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character
--   maps to a single code point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:score:KeyPhrase'</a>, <a>keyPhrase_score</a> - The level of
--   confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of the
--   detection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:text:KeyPhrase'</a>, <a>keyPhrase_text</a> - The text of a key
--   noun phrase.
--   
--   <a>$sel:beginOffset:KeyPhrase'</a>, <a>keyPhrase_beginOffset</a> - A
--   character offset in the input text that shows where the key phrase
--   begins (the first character is at position 0). The offset returns the
--   position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A <i>code point</i>
--   is the abstract character from a particular graphical representation.
--   For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character maps to a single code point.
newKeyPhrase :: KeyPhrase

--   <a>keyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties_jobStatus</a> - The current status
--   of the key phrases detection job. If the status is <tt>FAILED</tt>,

--   key phrases detection job completed.

--   Name (ARN) of the key phrases detection job. It is a unique, fully
--   qualified identifier for the job. It includes the AWS account, Region,
--   and the job ID. The format of the ARN is as follows:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:&lt;partition&gt;:comprehend:&lt;region&gt;:&lt;account-id&gt;:key-phrases-detection-job/&lt;job-id&gt;
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following is an example job ARN:
--

--   </pre>

--   <a>keyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties_volumeKmsKeyId</a> - ID for the
--   AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to
--   encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute
--   instance(s) that process the analysis job. The VolumeKmsKeyId can be
--   either of the following formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: <tt>"1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:submitTime:KeyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>keyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties_submitTime</a> - The time that the
--   key phrases detection job was submitted for processing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobName:KeyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,

--   assigned the key phrases detection job.
--

--   Resource Name (ARN) that gives Amazon Comprehend read access to your
--   input data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:KeyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>keyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties_jobId</a> - The identifier
--   assigned to the key phrases detection job.

-- | Provides configuration parameters for the output of topic detection
--   jobs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOutputDataConfig</a> smart constructor.
data OutputDataConfig
OutputDataConfig' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> OutputDataConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>OutputDataConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:OutputDataConfig'</a>,
--   <a>outputDataConfig_kmsKeyId</a> - ID for the AWS Key Management
--   Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt the output
--   results from an analysis job. The KmsKeyId can be one of the following
--   formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: <tt>"1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   <li>KMS Key Alias: <tt>"alias/ExampleAlias"</tt></li>
--   <li>ARN of a KMS Key Alias:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias"</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Uri:OutputDataConfig'</a>, <a>outputDataConfig_s3Uri</a> -
--   When you use the <tt>OutputDataConfig</tt> object with asynchronous
--   operations, you specify the Amazon S3 location where you want to write
--   the output data. The URI must be in the same region as the API
--   endpoint that you are calling. The location is used as the prefix for
--   the actual location of the output file.
--   
--   When the topic detection job is finished, the service creates an
--   output file in a directory specific to the job. The <tt>S3Uri</tt>
--   field contains the location of the output file, called
--   <tt>output.tar.gz</tt>. It is a compressed archive that contains the
--   ouput of the operation.
newOutputDataConfig :: Text -> OutputDataConfig

-- | Identifies the part of speech represented by the token and gives the
--   confidence that Amazon Comprehend has that the part of speech was
--   correctly identified. For more information about the parts of speech

--   confidence that Amazon Comprehend has that the part of speech was
--   correctly identified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tag:PartOfSpeechTag'</a>, <a>partOfSpeechTag_tag</a> -
--   Identifies the part of speech that the token represents.
newPartOfSpeechTag :: PartOfSpeechTag

-- | Provides information about a PII entities detection job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPiiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PiiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties
PiiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties' :: Maybe LanguageCode -> Maybe RedactionConfig -> Maybe InputDataConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe PiiEntitiesDetectionMode -> Maybe JobStatus -> Maybe PiiOutputDataConfig -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> PiiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties

-- | Create a value of <a>PiiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:PiiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>piiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties_languageCode</a> - The language
--   code of the input documents
--   
--   <a>$sel:redactionConfig:PiiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>piiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties_redactionConfig</a> - Provides
--   configuration parameters for PII entity redaction.
--   
--   This parameter is required if you set the <tt>Mode</tt> parameter to
--   <tt>ONLY_REDACTION</tt>. In that case, you must provide a
--   <tt>RedactionConfig</tt> definition that includes the
--   <tt>PiiEntityTypes</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputDataConfig:PiiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>piiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties_inputDataConfig</a> - The input
--   properties for a PII entities detection job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:PiiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>piiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties_message</a> - A description of
--   the status of a job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mode:PiiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>piiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties_mode</a> - Specifies whether the
--   output provides the locations (offsets) of PII entities or a file in
--   which PII entities are redacted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobStatus:PiiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>piiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties_jobStatus</a> - The current
--   status of the PII entities detection job. If the status is
--   <tt>FAILED</tt>, the <tt>Message</tt> field shows the reason for the
--   failure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputDataConfig:PiiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>piiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties_outputDataConfig</a> - The output
--   data configuration that you supplied when you created the PII entities
--   detection job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:PiiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>piiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties_endTime</a> - The time that the
--   PII entities detection job completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobArn:PiiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>piiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties_jobArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the PII entities detection job. It is a unique, fully
--   qualified identifier for the job. It includes the AWS account, Region,
--   and the job ID. The format of the ARN is as follows:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:&lt;partition&gt;:comprehend:&lt;region&gt;:&lt;account-id&gt;:pii-entities-detection-job/&lt;job-id&gt;
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following is an example job ARN:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:comprehend:us-west-2:111122223333:pii-entities-detection-job/1234abcd12ab34cd56ef1234567890ab
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:submitTime:PiiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>piiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties_submitTime</a> - The time that
--   the PII entities detection job was submitted for processing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobName:PiiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>piiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties_jobName</a> - The name that you
--   assigned the PII entities detection job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:PiiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>piiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties_dataAccessRoleArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that gives Amazon Comprehend read access to
--   your input data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:PiiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>piiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties_jobId</a> - The identifier
--   assigned to the PII entities detection job.
newPiiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties :: PiiEntitiesDetectionJobProperties

-- | Provides information about a PII entity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPiiEntity</a> smart constructor.
data PiiEntity
PiiEntity' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe PiiEntityType -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Int -> PiiEntity

-- | Create a value of <a>PiiEntity</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endOffset:PiiEntity'</a>, <a>piiEntity_endOffset</a> - A
--   character offset in the input text that shows where the PII entity
--   ends. The offset returns the position of each UTF-8 code point in the
--   string. A <i>code point</i> is the abstract character from a
--   particular graphical representation. For example, a multi-byte UTF-8
--   character maps to a single code point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':PiiEntity'</a>, <a>piiEntity_type</a> - The entity's
--   type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:score:PiiEntity'</a>, <a>piiEntity_score</a> - The level of
--   confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of the
--   detection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:beginOffset:PiiEntity'</a>, <a>piiEntity_beginOffset</a> - A
--   character offset in the input text that shows where the PII entity
--   begins (the first character is at position 0). The offset returns the
--   position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A <i>code point</i>
--   is the abstract character from a particular graphical representation.
--   For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character maps to a single code point.
newPiiEntity :: PiiEntity

--   of jobs based on the time that the job was submitted for processing.
--   Returns only jobs submitted before the specified time. Jobs are
--   returned in ascending order, oldest to newest.

--   returned in descending order, newest to oldest.

--   </pre>

--   Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to
--   encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute
--   instance(s) that process the analysis job. The VolumeKmsKeyId can be
--   either of the following formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: <tt>"1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:submitTime:SentimentDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>sentimentDetectionJobProperties_submitTime</a> - The time that the
--   sentiment detection job was submitted for processing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobName:SentimentDetectionJobProperties'</a>,

--   assigned to the sentiment detection job
--

--   <a>sentimentDetectionJobProperties_dataAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) that gives Amazon Comprehend read access to your
--   input data.

--   to the sentiment detection job.
newSentimentDetectionJobProperties :: SentimentDetectionJobProperties

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSentimentScore</a> smart constructor.
data SentimentScore

--   omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   The level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of
--   its detection of the <tt>NEGATIVE</tt> sentiment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mixed:SentimentScore'</a>, <a>sentimentScore_mixed</a> - The
--   level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of its
--   detection of the <tt>MIXED</tt> sentiment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:positive:SentimentScore'</a>, <a>sentimentScore_positive</a> -

--   its detection of the <tt>NEUTRAL</tt> sentiment.
newSentimentScore :: SentimentScore

-- | Represents a work in the input text that was recognized and assigned a
--   part of speech. There is one syntax token record for each word in the
--   source text.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSyntaxToken</a> smart constructor.
data SyntaxToken
SyntaxToken' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe PartOfSpeechTag -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> SyntaxToken

-- | Create a value of <a>SyntaxToken</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tokenId:SyntaxToken'</a>, <a>syntaxToken_tokenId</a> - A
--   unique identifier for a token.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partOfSpeech:SyntaxToken'</a>, <a>syntaxToken_partOfSpeech</a>
--   - Provides the part of speech label and the confidence level that
--   Amazon Comprehend has that the part of speech was correctly
--   identified. For more information, see how-syntax.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endOffset:SyntaxToken'</a>, <a>syntaxToken_endOffset</a> - The
--   zero-based offset from the beginning of the source text to the last
--   character in the word.
--   
--   <a>$sel:text:SyntaxToken'</a>, <a>syntaxToken_text</a> - The word that
--   was recognized in the source text.
--   
--   <a>$sel:beginOffset:SyntaxToken'</a>, <a>syntaxToken_beginOffset</a> -
--   The zero-based offset from the beginning of the source text to the
--   first character in the word.
newSyntaxToken :: SyntaxToken

-- | A key-value pair that adds as a metadata to a resource used by Amazon
--   Comprehend. For example, a tag with the key-value pair
--   Department:Sales might be added to a resource to indicate its use
--   by a particular department.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The second part of a
--   key-value pair that forms a tag associated with a given resource. For
--   instance, if you want to show which resources are used by which
--   departments, you might use Department as the initial (key) portion
--   of the pair, with a value of sales to indicate the sales department.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - The initial part of a key-value
--   pair that forms a tag associated with a given resource. For instance,
--   if you want to show which resources are used by which departments, you
--   might use Department as the key portion of the pair, with multiple
--   possible values such as sales, legal, and administration.
newTag :: Text -> Tag

-- | Provides information about a topic detection job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTopicsDetectionJobProperties</a> smart constructor.
data TopicsDetectionJobProperties
TopicsDetectionJobProperties' :: Maybe VpcConfig -> Maybe InputDataConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe JobStatus -> Maybe OutputDataConfig -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> TopicsDetectionJobProperties

-- | Create a value of <a>TopicsDetectionJobProperties</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcConfig:TopicsDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>topicsDetectionJobProperties_vpcConfig</a> - Configuration
--   parameters for a private Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) containing the
--   resources you are using for your topic detection job. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon VPC</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputDataConfig:TopicsDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>topicsDetectionJobProperties_inputDataConfig</a> - The input data
--   configuration supplied when you created the topic detection job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:TopicsDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>topicsDetectionJobProperties_message</a> - A description for the
--   status of a job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobStatus:TopicsDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>topicsDetectionJobProperties_jobStatus</a> - The current status of
--   the topic detection job. If the status is <tt>Failed</tt>, the reason
--   for the failure is shown in the <tt>Message</tt> field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputDataConfig:TopicsDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>topicsDetectionJobProperties_outputDataConfig</a> - The output data
--   configuration supplied when you created the topic detection job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:TopicsDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>topicsDetectionJobProperties_endTime</a> - The time that the topic
--   detection job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobArn:TopicsDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>topicsDetectionJobProperties_jobArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the topics detection job. It is a unique, fully qualified
--   identifier for the job. It includes the AWS account, Region, and the
--   job ID. The format of the ARN is as follows:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:&lt;partition&gt;:comprehend:&lt;region&gt;:&lt;account-id&gt;:topics-detection-job/&lt;job-id&gt;
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following is an example job ARN:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:comprehend:us-west-2:111122223333:topics-detection-job/1234abcd12ab34cd56ef1234567890ab
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeKmsKeyId:TopicsDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>topicsDetectionJobProperties_volumeKmsKeyId</a> - ID for the AWS
--   Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to
--   encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute
--   instance(s) that process the analysis job. The VolumeKmsKeyId can be
--   either of the following formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>KMS Key ID: <tt>"1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   <li>Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:submitTime:TopicsDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>topicsDetectionJobProperties_submitTime</a> - The time that the
--   topic detection job was submitted for processing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfTopics:TopicsDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>topicsDetectionJobProperties_numberOfTopics</a> - The number of
--   topics to detect supplied when you created the topic detection job.
--   The default is 10.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobName:TopicsDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>topicsDetectionJobProperties_jobName</a> - The name of the topic
--   detection job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataAccessRoleArn:TopicsDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>topicsDetectionJobProperties_dataAccessRoleArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Management (IAM) role that
--   grants Amazon Comprehend read access to your job data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:TopicsDetectionJobProperties'</a>,
--   <a>topicsDetectionJobProperties_jobId</a> - The identifier assigned to
--   the topic detection job.
newTopicsDetectionJobProperties :: TopicsDetectionJobProperties

-- | Configuration parameters for an optional private Virtual Private Cloud
--   (VPC) containing the resources you are using for the job. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon VPC</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVpcConfig</a> smart constructor.
data VpcConfig
VpcConfig' :: NonEmpty Text -> NonEmpty Text -> VpcConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>VpcConfig</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroupIds:VpcConfig'</a>,
--   <a>vpcConfig_securityGroupIds</a> - The ID number for a security group
--   on an instance of your private VPC. Security groups on your VPC
--   function serve as a virtual firewall to control inbound and outbound
--   traffic and provides security for the resources that youll be
--   accessing on the VPC. This ID number is preceded by "sg-", for
--   instance: "sg-03b388029b0a285ea". For more information, see
--   <a>Security Groups for your VPC</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnets:VpcConfig'</a>, <a>vpcConfig_subnets</a> - The ID for
--   each subnet being used in your private VPC. This subnet is a subset of
--   the a range of IPv4 addresses used by the VPC and is specific to a
--   given availability zone in the VPCs region. This ID number is
--   preceded by "subnet-", for instance: "subnet-04ccf456919e69055". For
--   more information, see <a>VPCs and Subnets</a>.
newVpcConfig :: NonEmpty Text -> NonEmpty Text -> VpcConfig
